text: Tasting at the DC Ratebeer cider/mead tasting at Radagasts, then a bottle brought back from the NE from my gf. Golden heaven juice. Full apples and honey, mild spice. Nothing contrived, not too sweet or heavy, just awesome. Love this.

Bottle from SAQ, tried at Mont Royal, Montreal.
Golden/amber colour, clear.
Aroma: sweet apple, barrel, raisins, hint of alcohol.
Very sweet taste, full body, thick, oily.
Absolutely fantastic! Very complex, heavy, but drinkable.

Tons of stewed apples, cinnamon and apple pie. Very sweet and slightly cloying. Amazing depth of stewed apples, cinnamon, over ripe raisins with no carbonation, very heavy and cloying and very sweet. Fucking fantastic
Bottle at home. Syrupy thick golden copper pour. Nose is rich apple sauce and honey. Tastes of honey, ripe apples, white wine, some gummy candy. Thick heavy bodied. Quite nice.

Small bottle generously shared by luttonm, I cant express how grateful I am! Glowing golden color with no head. Aroma is red apple skin, sweet, some wild tartness, honey, very rich and complex. Taste is red apples, intense and concentrated, wild and tart, but without actually being sour, honey again, caramel. Immensely great. Like a naturally wild-fermented apple gummy bear. No carbonation, warming finish. This is one of the most amazing drinks Ive ever had.

Bottle in Seattle. Rainy night tasting. 50ml bottle, thanks hugely to Laurence who picked this up in Montreal and gave to me in Oaxaca. Whiskey orange, still, no head. Incredibly rich depths on nose. Apple caramel, apple essential oil. Liquid gold. Spicy first impression, alcohol dancing on tongue. Fruit leather, fruit tart cake, golden raisins. Rum soaked apricots. Dates. Surprisingly dark fruit overtones. Honey and fruit turkish delight. Nose becomes lightly harsh after awhile. Utterly delicious and complex. Lovely essence of fresh, clean, delicious apples. Fantastic treat.

Bottle pour at Matts. Huge thanks for the share! A lighter copper pour with no head. Dense aroma with sugars and bold apple. Thick, with a ton of caramel sugar, brown sugar, and a sour apple linger. Caramel apple late afterthought. Thick, but juicy as a linger. Incredible ice cider, though I have learned to expect no less.
Bottle: Poured a golden with bubbles. Aroma is sweet fruit. Taste is a mix of honey and apple.

200ml bottle pours a clear, butterscotch amber with zero head but nice legs. Nose is quite lovely, apples, honey, baking spices, pears, honeycomb. Flavor is apple, stone fruit, spice. Full bodied, sticky, lasting finish.
From a bottle at the RB cider tasting December 2016. Pours a clear pale oopper with a scant head. Dead fall aromas. Flavors of ripe apples and stone fruits. Sweet and fabulous.

Bottle shared, thanks to kermis. Pours a clear amber, no head. Aroma of caramalised apples, pears, just the best apple juice. Taste is very sweet, full body, No carbonation. What a delicious beverage.

Shared bottle at kermis courtesy of Kermis. Clear orange amber with no head. Big honey sweet apples, appleskin, hints of nutmeg and cinnamon. Big sweet. Medium body, low carbonation. Dry tannin like notes, fruit tree woodiness. Big sweet fruity finish.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Bottle. 2010 vintage. Clear amber liquid. Aroma of red apples, rosehip, raw sugar, sweet alcohol, toffee, raisins and grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet with notes of caramel, apple, rosehip, raisins and sweet cherries. Full bodied with sticky mouthfeel. Delicious stuff! Quite hearty and heavy. Complex.

vintage 2011 bottle shared with a friend, poured a deep dark golden colour with no head. nose of strong sweet apples, apple pie, light sweet cinnamon, light green apples, sticky, caramel, sweet apple juice, light vanilla, light warm alcoholic, thick mouthfeel. really enjoyable
Vintage 2010. Clear copper and oily looking. Big juicy apple, cinnamon aroma. Deliciously smooth, very slight alcohol flavor, pie filling, brown sugar. So good

Vintage 2012. Délicieux cidre dégustée en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina. Le liquide qui danse devant moi colle juste assez à mon verre pour me mettre justement leau à la bouche. Jolies pommes rondes givrées mais non gelées et encore moins pourries, un parfum de pommier, de rosée, de givre. Ma langue est caressée par un sucre plaisant et frais. De la tarte aux pommes, un alcool qui nest pas exempt dun liquide au corps à la fois affirmé et délicat. Ô combien cela est agréable!

2006 vintage. Pours bright pale golden. Aroma is very complex: oven-baked apples, caramel, spruce, bogwood, acorn, poire-au-vin, quince... Starts sweet and oily, developing a crisp acidity and finishing long. Very good.

April 22, 2016. Bottle, vintage 2009. 
Clear golden with no head. Intense apple aroma with tart apple skins, sweet juicy baked apples, some toffee notes, a touch of raisins, 
Taste is sweet and fruity sour.Finish is tart slightly astringent apple skins, sweet sugary, baked apples, lightly warming alcohol, 
Full bodied, oily and slightly sticky texture. 
Great, sweet and tart juicy apples.
Very nice balance between sweet and tart! Loads of apple both on nose and in flavour. For me this is amazing, I really like it!

A Christmas gift! Poured a clear, light golden colour with no head. The aroma is powerful, full of green apple, knock out nose. Smooth syrupy mouth feel - expected that with the previous reviews. A real flavour bomb, almost an apple mead, although Id not want to sample this in large quantities.
Pours very clear golden with no head. Aroma; Rich Apple aroma, a little vinous, vanilla amd a touch of wood. Taste; Rich apple taste, vinous, vanilla, acidic and very smooth.
Bottle shared at tasting. Super clear golden pour. Intense apple aroma. Taste follows, so smooth and tart. Cant believe this is 13%. Amazing!
Bottle. Holy hell, this is unbelievable. Clear orange pour. Ive never tasted rich apple like this before. Fuck. Wow. Amazing.

Bottle. Pours crystal clear golden. Aroma has loads of apple most, Rinkeby, red apples, vanilla and light bourbon notes. Light moldy and some spices, almost ginger. Taste is juicy, caramel, acidic apples, red apples, vanilla and bourbon notes. Sweet honet and light sugary mouthfeel. Warming finish, but not boozy at all.

30 ml sample. Thanks bunget. Clear deep golden, no head. Big fresh apple aroma, a touch of cidery notes. Big intense taste, very sweet, apples, some malic acidity and a touch of alcohol. Big and yummy, but not much complexity. (backlog 17-JAN-2016).

Bottle brought home by Krellan! Pours apple juice.. Not very thick or oily or anything, just a pale, clear golden. Aroma has lots of ripe apples, apple juice, yeast, surprisingly much spice, pepper, slight vinous alcohol, slight ginger. Taste is sweet, super fruity, nice tartness, leading to an almost caramel sweet finish. Again slight spicy burn, a subtle hint of alcohol, but in general this is super drinkable! Smooth, spicy texture, slghtly oily.

This is my first ice cider.

Look: clear, orange, no head.

Aroma: ripe apples, apple jam, sweet wine.
Taste: good sweet-sour balance.
Flavour: apples, some pleasant dessert alcohol notes.

Not too complex but very pleasant and good balanced.
Not sure how to rate ice ciders but I like this one.

2015/12/31 - Pours a clear, orange straw colour with no head. Aroma is both sweet and sour apple, wood and slight alcohol. Taste is sweet and sour apple, cinnamon, wood, syrup and a hint of alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium and syrupy with no carbonation and a long, slightly warming finish. Not really sure how to rate this, but I did very much enjoy it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille 375ml. Couleur or liquide, film sur les parois du verre. Arôme de pomme, sucre dérable, pomme cuite. Goût de pomme fraiche, alcool, légère acidité, sucré, petite touche dérable. Corps moyen-dense, texture enrobante.

Neige Premiere Récolte 2012. 375 ml, bottled. BB 2019. Pours clear straw with no head. Aroma: Apple, wood. Syrupy notes. Taste: Very sweet. syrup. Wood. Apples. Concentrated flavours. Moldy mushrooms. Some mild acidity. Palate: Medium body, slippery. Sweet aftertaste, with slight tartness. Not bad, interesting (4.11.2015).

Honey like Amber appearance. Strong concentrated apple and some honey sweetness on the nose. Slightly syrupy body gives a sweet apple flavour light spice component suggests cinnamon and clove. Am I imagining that?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear amber color, no head. Rich apple nose, caramel, vanilla, dried fruit, over-ripe and concentrated fruit. Heavy sweet taste, apple, fine acidity, concentrated, well balanced, long lasting. Medium body, flat carbonation, oily to sticky texture.

Bottle shared by Bursprak! Thx! Pours clear rusty with no head. Aroma of wild honey, apples, tart pear and dessert liquor. Taste of apples, wild honey, dessert wine, pears, and weak sweet liquor. Complex but yet simple. Very nice.

Bottle shared by me @ 3/4 Dangerous Bottle Shares meets Moules Frites. Oily flat deep golden pour. Taste has apples (duh), some floral notes, sweet syrupy notes, more apples with some hint of lemons.

This is just so well made and delicious!

Bottle at Chris and Ruts pre-GBBF 2015. Clear golden color with no head. Sweet apples, fruity, yeasty aroma. Sweet apple flavour and easy to drink. I really liked it and thats what my rateing is about.

375ml boxed slender bottle, ¿2014 Vintage, kindly hauled by bursprak to the Aarhus Belgisk Blåmuslinger Tasting, 08/2015. - luminous honey, treacling pour, no head. Sensationally rich nose of organic cinnamon&vanilla-doused fresh oven baked apple pie with textured sour apple chunks, a wild apple peel touch, wild autumn apples yet to be harvested lying await in the pastured fields, topped by a gorgeous juicy acidity. - Taste starts off sweet and condensed like apple sirup, before turning into a mellifluous layered texture of fruity-sweet and fruity-sour, revealing it seems nothing but the hidden autumn essence of apples, while leaving room for a couple of slices of pear: near-almond, nutty sweetness, apple butter on Honigbrot, - then a natural version of a Haribo apple rings acidity, rounding it off. - Mouthfeel is lusciously balanced, avoiding cloying sweetness, ensuring savoury stickiness, coating the palate in vivid nectar. - A dense cryconcentration of "appleness", in the same rich tactile sense that Eisbocks are the black hole pinnacle of lager culture and Cantillon FouFoune is a cubist deconstruction of an apricot.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours a thick, dark clear golden. Aromas of apples, sweet red appels, light tart green apples, honey, sweet pear, vanilla, wood. Taste is sweet apples, tart apples, sweet pear, vanilla. Hot fucking damn, this is good!

De couleur orange rouge et très liquoreuse. On sens des de pomme mûre et de canelle .c est très goûteux en bouche la pomme domine et suivit par un petit goût de canelle très bon mélange se qui le fun c est un produit de chez nous .

Old rating rerated 28.07.2015, 0,375l bottle (2011 vintage) @ home:
Flat, nice coppery color. Aroma is sweet concentrated fruity, concentrated fresh applejuice, sugar, oak, apple skin, grass, alcohol. Taste is sweet concentrated fruity, sugar, concentrated fresh applejuice, apple skin, oak, alcohol, grass, citrus. Nice acidic and sysupy mouthfeel. Very nice.
[2012] 375ml bottle. Clear deep golden liquid. Flavors are baked apples, apple pie, apple peel, caramel, cinnamon and alcohol with tangy notes. Medium to full body, smooth and syrupy.

Bottle - Vintage 2010 - Cooked apples, some light tartness and a touch of spice. Clear copper. Sweet apple and almost bitter skins with a long intense finish. Nice, but not as nice as others I have had.

Pours a clear dark copper. Aroma is cooked apple, spices, lightly tart and some apple pie like qualities. Flavour is apple pie filling, cooked apple, light tartness, light alcohol(not in an bad way), spices, and cinnamon.

Thanks to cfrancis for this one. Pours a clear orangish amber with no head or bubbles. Aroma of sweet apples, light tartness, Apple pie like sweetness with some spices. Taste is sweet apples, cinnamon, Apple pie with some tart apples and some light alcohol on the finish. First ice cider ever but this is just great... Complex, smooth and easy to drink.

Bottle: Bright, burnt amber color; oily body, thick, substantially clear, & very still. Huge aroma of fresh, ripe, tart, & sweet apples, glazed with sugar & slightly caramelized. Loads of sweetness on the nose, but so very enticing. Hint of some warming spice, perhaps that could just be the booze creeping in. Flavor is even more explosive. So rich, sweet, decadent, & robust. Insanely pure & intensely sweet apple quality. Tart for only a moment before youre launched into a land of residual & slightly burnt sugars. Sweet apple pieces, apple pie filling, honey, & even a touch of white wine-like acidity near the finish. Again, I get a slightly warming spice on the tongue, but it could just be from the alcohol. Still doesnt seem anywhere close to 13% ABV, though. Smooth, semi-thick body; wet finish. Thanks to Jeff for introducing me to this god-nectar. Now I am forever cursing with spending the 30-40$ for a bottle whenever I see it. Absolutely delicious.
Bottle courtesy of kraddel, thank you sir. Beautiful deep clear golden amber color. Intense apple aroma. Taste is only lightly sweet apple flesh, honey. Really nice.

no head. golden deep yellow colour. aroma is old cheese, floral, bit of candy. taste is rich apple juice, bit of candy with a nice sourish kick in the finish. leaves lacing and "tears" on the glass. dense mouthfeel, no carbonation. bottle, recolte 2010 / 12 abv / thanks rood for this awesome treat!
Aroma is very boozy, strawberry, cinnamon, apple. Taste is apple sweet candy. Synesthesia experience is pink. Awesome balance between the sugar and the malic acid. Good one!

375ml bottle. 2010 vintage. clear golden/maple syrup colour leaving "legs" when moved around the glass. aroma is sweet, concentrated apples, a little alcohol and syrupy. taste is incredible. sticky feel in the mouth. just the right balance between alcohol and sweetness. obviously extremely apple-y. just as I expected it to taste if not better. incredibly easy to sip away.

Thanks a bunch jredmond! Clean tawny amber pour with a nice streaking on the glass. Deep and rich appley notes with a touch of almond, alcohol, orange rind, and dehydrated apple. Warming in the mouth with a depth of character that is quite nice. Warming alcohol on the finish with a full and syrupy finish. What a treat!

Pours a clean medium honey golden color. Aromas are tart apple, baked apple pie, honey, beeswax and some floral hay. Palate follows with nice balance of sweetness and tangy tart apple. Lingers with a nice tannic structure and tons of layers of apple complexity.

375 ml bottle, 2009 vintage. Trade from TimE. Clear golden brown with some bubbles but no head. Aromas of apples, vanilla, light booze. Tastes of big sweet and tart apples, light booze, vanilla, syrup. Medium-light body with a dry and warm finish. Low to still carbonation. Fantastic ice cider. Goes down way too easy for the ABV.

bottle - This cidery consistently does remarkable things with apples. Their flagship ice cider, Premiere, is no exception. It has an incredibly rich apple aroma. The flavor is very sweet and full of apples with some caramelized character. You cant go wrong with any of their ice ciders. Excellent dessert sipper.

Bottle: Thanks Julien: Vintage 2009:
Clear orange.
Aroma of apple peel, wood toast, some manure.
Flavours of apples, tart, tobacco, wood, toast, some bitters, vinous.
Aftertaste is wood, tart, apples, light dessert wine.
No carbo, light watery close to silky mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle shared at a tasting, 2009. Clear copper pour. Aroma of caramel, apple pie. Taste is sweet, mellow caramel apple flavors, light cinnamon. Palate is rich, smooth and delicately warming. Really tasty.

Bottle many thx to _angst_ cons 2014-10-28 Göteborg
AR: almonds, tutti frutti, floral
AP: ruby/rose clear colored body, no head
F: first a woody old feeling (I just ignore this snice the bottle been open for a while), cocentrated baby apple juice, wee warming feeling, wee marzipan,
50cl bottle bought at el corte ingles, lisbon long time ago! Neige Recolte 2003. Color is copper. No head. Body is smooth, oily and quite thick. High sweetness. Aroma is caramel, cinnamon, apple.

200 ml bottle thanks to _angst_! 12% ABV, sampled on August 21, 2014.Took notes as of "Neige cidre de glace - Ice Cider - Premiére.Clear deep golden to copper color, no head, amazing thick legs on the glass. Semi sweet, apple, warm apples in the sun, apple sauce, alcohol scent. Also hints fo spices. Sweet, apples, apple peel from red apples, slight tart taste. Apple, apple peel, apple sauce aftertaste. Rather smooth mouthfeel, a bit tart peel bitter finish. Slight bit warming.Very nice indeed! Works superb as a small glass to enjoy. Very happy to have tasted this!

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 Bottle @Fuck - I think we cured Lillquists man-flu! Clear dark golden with alcohol curtains, no head. Aroma has sweet and sour apples and something heavenly toffe-like. Sweet, sticky flavour, sweet apples with just the perfect little acidic bite. Lovely! Thanks again, Bamsen!

Bottle from Saxo - thank you very much, John! Pours slightly thick amber with a few bubbles on the surface. Clear aroma of long-preserved apples and leaves. Sweet flavour of well-layered apples and natural sugar. Oily texture. Lingering sweet-sourish aftertaste. A heavenly beverage, indeed!

Bottle, big thanks to _angst_! Clear golden color, absolutely no head. Sweet overripe apples, fruity, yeasty, apple juice, vinous notes. Sweet apple flavor, apple juice, warming alcohol, vinous, overripe apples. A bit hard to rate. Its very good, but kinda focuses all on the apples. Really sweet and with alcohol well hidden.

30/V/14 - 37.5cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: ?, 2009 reserva (2014-584) Thanks to 77ships for the trade!
Clear dark orange to reddish liquid, pretty thick. Aroma: lots of ripe to overripe apples, apple juice, apple skin. MF: oily texture, pretty thick, some alcohol burning. Taste: sweet, pretty acidic, lemon juice, alcohol, apple juice, green apple skin. Aftertaste: alcohol burn, pretty acidic, lemony, bit sugary, bitter touch, apple skin, more alcohol, sour apples.

Bottle shared by sic1314 @ DTE tasting. Clear orangy color, no head. Aroma is a mix of apple, wine and alcohol. Taste apple, a bit winey, alcohol, a touch of overripe fruits. Full flavored and pretty nice, but imo this is not the best even though Ive only rated two at this point I think.

Bottle at the DTE tasting, Den Haag. Poured a crystal clear medium orange amber with no life at all. The aroma is sweet sticky apple. The flavour is medium to strong sweet with a rich sweet earthy apple , light alcoholic palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation. So hard to rate, but so very good.

Bottle shared at the DTE tasting thanks to sic1314. Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma of rich apples, wood, caramel, pears. Flavour is light heavy sweet. The alcohol not at all noticeable in the palate. Full bodied with doper soft carbonation.

bottle @THT courtesy of Sic1314, big thanks.
No head or carbonation. Clear golden pour. Aroma of apples. Lovely sweetness. A gorgeous Ice Cider

Thanks Tderoeck for the share.
Cuivrée tirant plus sur lacajou foncé.
Arôme ici aussi de pomme caramélisée, la première dominant et le dernier en accompagnement. 
Le tout est frais, pomme agréable, pointe acidulée laissant plus paraitre le profil chaire de la pomme. Note encore ce côté épicé, tannin? Un cran en dessous de la Neige.
Poured deep amber with no head. Aroma of sweet, concentrated apple. Full body, flavour is sticky, sweet apple.

2009 Vintage. Obtained in a trade with tom10101. Thanks! Drank about 1/3 of a 375 ml. bottle @ Barely legal tasting room. Drank next to the Reserve. Looks touch darker than the other one, pours a light copper golden. Nose is sweet apples, light syrup de Liège, apple juice, quite alcoholic. Tastes quite alcoholic, fairly strongly so, thick syrupy apples, syrup de Liège, thick syrupy, strongly sweet with sugar, flowers and a bitter woody finish, linger alcohol. Thick syrupy. Quite nice, the Reserve easily beat this one.

Thnx to 77ships . 
Pours the same as the reserve version . 
Smell is even more intense . 
Intense, more boozy taste . Apples, apples, apples . Very intense, apples . 
Bit more dry . Very simiar, yet if you taste them together, I slightly prefer the Reserve version .
Bottle at Craigs tasting. Sweet, overwhelmingly rich apples, fruity, tart, pretty good.

Gold with some sediment. Nose is huge. A crap load of apple and some strawberry and peach skins and oak. Insanely sweet. Burns the esophagus a bit. Smooth with candy covered apple and cotton candy. Super fruity, peachy and touches of cherry.

Bottle. Pours orange gold with a hint of brown. Aroma is fresh pressed sweet apple cider. This is very sweet, but not cloying, flavors of cortland apple and a touch of raisin. Very concentrated, natural apple flavor. 12% well hidden. One of the best dessert wines I have tasted.
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 This is some of the best ice wine I have had. Sweet tasting wonderful aroma and easy finish.

Fantastisk, aromen är inte särskilt trevlig men den smakar fantastiskt! Väldigt kraftfull och fyllig. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ja det här var ju verkligen en höjdare. Aroman av lite gamla äpplen. Smaken var väldigt söt, med en balans mellan sötman och äpplets syrlighet

Bottle @ The HUGE Tasting. The pours deep gold with no head whatsoever. The nose is straight-up red apples. Strong, concentrated. Great clarity of aroma. The taste is a bit less cohesive. Unwashed red apples, skin. A little acid. A touch of hot wood. Honey. Syrupy hot finish. Full, rich and oily. Overall, a real treat. Cheers Paulo!

Bottle, 2009 vintage, thanks to TimE, 01/26/2014. Pours burnished gold, few bubbles initially but really no head. Aroma is bright, intense sweet apple, crystallized syrup-like texture, woody vanilla finish, almost leathery. Taste is honey sweet apples, intense, mead-like, light tart accents on top mixing with touch of alcohol. Medium, oily body. Really tasty.

Échantillon 50 ml. 12.5%. Merci Jo. Cuoleur jeune foncé. Arôme de pomme cuite, intense. En bouche, pommes sucrées, un peu acide, un peu de sucre, bien balancée. En finale, la pomme sétale et appelle une autre gorgée. Excellent.

Bottle split at the HUUUUUUUUUUUUGeeeeee Tasting bash, big thanks to Paulo, 03/01/14.
Clear golden with moderate white spotting and edgework.
Nose is light puke, sweet smelling apple pulp, sugar, vanilla, apple Danish strudel.
Taste comprises apple pulp, apple pie filling, Apple strudel notes, pure apple hit.
Full bodied, soft carbonation, slick feel, sweet closure with warming  booze seeping into play.
Decent.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at the mega tasting of ultimate doom. It pours clear deep golden amber. The nose is intense, fresh red apple, oily, honey and vanilla. Perhaps a touch too sweet on the nose. The taste is smooth, tangy apple, candy, oily, honey, warming alcohol, apple skin, pear and nuances of tartness and sherbet. Full body and oily mouth-feel. Smooth, rich and slick. Really nice balance. Intense appley goodness.

A big thanks to Paul and Lorna for this beauty. Not sure on how to describe this but it is liquid gold. Reminds me a lot of a very good dessert wine. Nose is full of vanilla and honey, big apricot and stewed apples. Taste is silky smooth toffee and honey, sweet and succulent apple pie and raisins. Very stone fruit forward with notes of peach and apricot. Ripe pear juice right on the finish. The whole time apples are stealing the show. Its practically an amazing sticky. Seriously good stuff

Appearance: Deep golden color with no head.Aroma: Lovely apple fruity. Vanilla and caramel.Palate: Medium to full body. A bit sweet and flat carbonation. Oily texture.Taste: Lovely smooth fresh apple fruity. Some caramel and mild acidic.Overall impression: WoW! Lovely natural apple feeling. Smooth and warming. Perfect for desserts.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet Nettorder, Norway.First rating in 2014 and probably one of the highest when we say 31 dec 14

Bottle from great Cunningham - thank you a lot my friend for getting my first ice cider ever! The cider pours out in a wonderful deep golden colour with smooth body. Great aroma of ripe apples, honey and sweetness. Also great taste of very ripe apples, caramel, honey and sweet straw. Very, very swett finish. Great in aroma and taste, but in the end just a little bit too sweet for me.

First I have to thank Cunningham for donating us that beautiful beverage Second I have to thank McTapp for sharing that one with me. And at least I have to thank that {brewery} for sharing that beverage with the world. Where to start ? Quite difficult. Maybe with that superb look which reminds you liquid honey. Or maybe with that smell of apple being mixed up with the most expensive honey you can imagine. The only thing you can (worry) about is the sweetness in the taste. The rest is unimaginable and pure apple with syrup and honey. With some alcohol. With the most unbelievable quaffyness you can imagine. I have never tried anything comparable to that one. Like a german ice wine made out of apples. In high quality. Crazy stuff.

Bottle, served on ice in a tumbler. Rich gold, no head. Aroma is sweet, apples, wood and alcohol. Taste is glorious, very sweet, with a sour note towards the end. Body is thick and syrupy, long lasting sweetness, alcoholic burn. Seems more like a liqueur than a cider. At the price, one for special occasions.
Bottle with glass raise to Ramy for the heads up. Pours golden orange. Nose and taste of caramel apple, frozen apple, vanilla, tangy apple syrup and caramelized apple. Mouth-coating. Full bodied.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2014 Bottle at least a few years old but no date to be found anywhere, opened to celebrate the end of my semester. Pours a lovely dark golden amber. Aroma is apples, apple juice, apple skin, caramel, some alcohol. Taste is concentrated apple juice, very sweet, quite tart, with some bitterness as well. Finish is tart, sweet, and lightly bitter. Medium body, smooth, lightly syrupy texture. Fantastic stuff.Update: The store I got this from bought the bottle back in February of 2005, so this was at least 9 years old!

Cold bottle, 2009 vintage. Pale pink / golden orange, mostly clear and slightly hazy. Smell is sweet apple peel, slight strawberry. Body is medium, smooth, slight carbonation. Taste - mostly peach with apple notes, alcohol comes through noticeably and brings a sharpness. Its eye-wateringly sweet and I couldnt drink a lot of it. Luckily I shared the bottle. This is more acidic than the Hiver version and less sweet, which balances it out a bit. Good.

Pours a nice and still light copper. Aroma is of nice and ripe apples. Taste is really sweet but also tart with a good amount of complexity. Ill echo what czar said but I can really taste the apple skin in there. Alcohol shows a little but otherwise it is really drinkable. Excellent!

Had the unfortunate experience of trying this at the same time as the winter harvest, which is miles better (and priced accordingly). Straightforward apple aroma. Light Golden brown color. Taste is intensely sweet, perhaps too much so. Strong apple flavors that are fairly straightforward and ciderly. Not quite as complex and unique as I was expecting. Pay the extra money for the winter harvest, it's worth it. This, however, is not worth the steep price tag. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010 harvest bottle from tom10101 as an extra, thanks man! Shared with my girlfriend after dinner. Beautiful golden pour, looks like golden honey in a glass, no carbonation. Aroma is sweet apples, and some warmth from the booze. Taste is sweet candy apple, slight tart, a little heat from the booze. This is my first Ice cider ever...and I must say this delicious stuff, major thanks to Tommy for suggesting this, I will need to try more of these.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2013 2010 harvest. clear medium dark golden, red hue, nice legs showing. bright and fresh lightly tart apples, nice complex sugars, hint of caramelized apples in butter, red skin with its astringency, pepper and spicy. medium body - oily and silky, sweet, warming, lightly tart and astringent finish. very good!

Stylish 375ml bottle from TheDrinkShop.com. Orangey gold amber colour, no head and aroma of butter, apple pie, pastry and peach. The taste is rich sweet concentrated apple, with some pastry, honey & apricot notes and alittle tartness. Thick oily mouth feel, full bodied, no carbonation, warming tart but crisp finish. Nicely balanced and very drinkable.

375mL $35. Still, deep orange copper pour. Thick legs. Crystal clear. Nose is thick buttery apple pie complete with crust and whipped cream. Dessert heavy. Taste is tangy, more tart than other ice ciders. Refreshing though with a thick mouthfeel up front and acidic, lactic finish. Crisp and delicious.

Pours a viscous clear deep golden color. Aromas of spice, honey, baked apples, and dried peach explode from the glass, along with a bit of acid/mild barnyard to cut through. The palate is very Sauternes like, with rich flavors of apple, apricot, honey, and a bit of apple skin/tart apple. Very well balanced, not heavy, finishes clean.
Bottle shared with northropfrye and cards04. Ditto what cards04 said. This is like apples making sweet sexy love in my mouth. Awesome!

like two apples making love in my mouth. Simply one of the most divine things I have ever drank. Thanks Northropfrye for this treat. Amazing over ripe apple aromas. Interesting spiceflavours with amazing Apple flavours. So so good.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2013 Bottle from the SAQ in Montreal. Light golden amber colour. Nutty apple aroma, slightly tart. Taste is sweet apples, vanilla, tartness. Overall a fabulous ice cider. Glad I had a chance to try this.

Bottle. Pours crystal clear golden orange with no head. Aroma is intensified apple - I dont know how else to describe it. Flavor is about the same, quite sweet, strong apple goodness. Medium body, some warming from the ABV. Pretty darn tasty for desert.

Bottles. Orange still pour. Cant believe I havent rated this yet. Seemed better with a bit of age. Stark apple and light sweet and hints of maple. Isnt as good as the special versions but still sweet and potent.

Apple, caramel, slight blue cheese, honey in the nose. 
Huge apple, honey, light lemon, cheese, nicely acidic to balance the huge syrupy sweetness, with a touch of alcohol burn as well. Fully body, oily and silky. Great stuff. I liked the sparkling version a bit more.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2013 Bottle from Frasers Wine Merchants [270413]
Brillant golden yellow, crystal clear, thin white rim around glass, great apperance for a cider/apple ice wine. Beautiful packaging.
Aroma - Intense sweet fresh apples, slighty tart note initially, some warming alcohol on the nose, dab of apple caramel
Taste - Extremely rich intense fresh apple nectar, smooth apple pie filling, incredible apple flavour, very fresh, just the sweet juicy part of the apple concentrated, what an incredible flavour - an explosion of apple in the mouth.  Its not complex - its just sweet apples but the flavour is phenomenal. 
Palate - Full body, very very smooth, rich lingering sweet intense fresh apple, its sweet but not too sweet, completely mouthcoating the mouth with that fantastic apple nectar. The finish is flawless - very long linger of that fantastic rich apple and so so smooth.
Overall - This is one of the best flavoured liquids I have ever tasted. Its worth the money to try once. Im really seriously thinking of getting the top of the range version now! Incredible!

Same bottle [280413].....wonderful very intense sweet, but not too sweet fresh apple - its the best part of the apple flavour concentrated into a very smooth oily but sticky liquid nectar...im staying at 4.6

200ml bottle. 2010. ABV 12.5%. A clear golden-copper body, no head, oily legs on the glass, similar to a good wine. Aroma is just mesmerizing: tons of ripe McIntosh apples, wine, oak barrel, vanilla, honey. Im salivating just smelling it. Taste is repugnantly delicious: a mix of the sweetest apple liquor and vinegar, honey, vanilla, hints of booze. Oily and very sticky body. I must admit its my first ice cider, but Im impressed.

37,5cl Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Shared with Pops.  Thanks to Meilbye for picking it up. Pours clear golden with a few bubbles on top. Lots of fresh red apples, a bit of vanilla and wood. Crisp and warming with a dry finish. Remarkable fruityness. Lovely sipper. A shame it is so expensive.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2013 2009 Vintage. 375mL bottle, pours an uncarbonated clear golden. Aroma is full of pure apples, honey, vanilla, and a little treacle. Flavour is supremely complex, with loads of vanilla, treacle, honey and apples. The depth of flavours and richness is remarkable - the palate is sweet, but not cloying, leaving rich notes of caramel apple, vanilla and treacle toffee. Oh man is this good. Bloody fantastic.

Bottle (200 ml). Clear straw color with no head. Aroma is a lot of fresh apples and some sugar notes. Very tasty. Moderate to heavy sweetness (reasonable considering its an Ice Cider). Intense fresh apple notes (only apples, theres no other fruits presence like some other Ice Cider). Mouthfeel is sirupy, but not as thick as Récolte dHiver. Warming alcohol/sugar. Another wonder by La Face Cachée. Easily drinkable for an Ice Cider and so tasty!

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2013 2010 bottle. Glowing golden-amber body.  Nose is rich, sweet, and intense apples.  Just the slightest hints of caramel filling things out.  Flavor is an assault of sweet, but not cloying, ripe apples.  Medium bodied, lightly syrupy, nice sweet finish.  A phenomenal product--an apple lovers dream.
Bottled. Pale golden in color, no head. Apple, more fresh apple and some sweetness in aroma. More of them same fresh apples in taste. Crisp and refreshing, nice one.

Pours a clear golden/mild amber color...bright like apple juice...oily/syrupy with great legs.  Aroma has loads of fresh from the orchard apple...like fresh cider...touch of booziness and a faint hint of caramel.  Flavor is fresh apple cider...almost a hint of brandy...sweet yet tart with mild caramel.  Mouthfeel is medium and syrupy with a slightly sweet apple/caramel finish that warms.  Fabulous!!!

2009 vintage. Like a Westons vintage cider on steroids with a sweeter, fuller mid palate and a nice sweet sour finish. Moderate funky, but big on the honey apple sweetness. No carbonation. A tad cloying and the minimal carbonation makes it a bit tough going, but still a wonderful treat;.
Thanks to Andrew for all of these awesome ciders.  Tart apple some cinnamon. Tart and earthy. Juicy apples. Good stuff. A bit of boozey. 8/3/7/3/15

Bottled. Poured crystal-clear bright golden and completely still. The aroma picked up spiced apple cider, peppery notes, and a kiss of cucumber.. warm and inviting. The flavor found warm, mulled apple cider, honey, and mango with another rich layer of light fruit and a touch of rum warmth behind.. finished warm with a great dose of apple tardiness. Heavier-bodied and syrupy on the palate.. crisp, with great balance.. loved it!

200mL Bottle, purchased at Atwater SAQ - Montreal, QC. Blossomy, syrup and caramel nose. A rich balance of acid and juice. The tropical fruits lay a little lower on this one and the more cooked, aged, and darker edges of apples come out. The snappy acid balance is so great for the level of sugar. Excellent overall, but Id take a nip more complexity out of the apple sugars in the middle.

Bottle, 2007 on the cork. Pours golden nectar, clear. Nose is intensive cider-apple, with some honey, a bit of oak. Very alluring, just makes me want to sniff it all night - excellent apple acidity / sweetness combination. Body is thick, full. Sweet, but with a good deal of acidity balancing it out. Ripe apples. Cinnamon. Really intensive. This is now my favourite dessert wine. The thickness, intensity combined with the real apple flavors. Really good.

Small pour from the tasting. Pours a rich amber gold hue, touc of haze, but rich glow. Wow. No head. Aromas are rich honey and apple, ridiculous sweetness, with tasty apple, honey, kiss of honey. Rich and a kiss of oak. Big apple flavors, rich and generous. Wow. Rich and sweet, apples and honeycrisp, touches of sweetness. Finish lingers a touch tart. Rich and big flavors, a bit of a stickiness yet silky as it goes down. Wow. Hard to express this one in words. The nose isnt all there, but the liquid itself preaches assertive rice flavors with some nice tartness and fruit.

It pours golden yellow with reddish-orange highlights. The aroma has notes of: wet-dirt, alcohol, stewed-apples, slight citrus, and fermented apple cores. The taste is heavy sweet that finishes medium tart; there are notes of: apple cores, alcohol, liquorice, and a slight almond finish. The palate is full bodied, fairly viscous, long tart finish, and a big mouth-feel. Overall, might tasty, a bit sweet for my liking - but hard to argue with. Its definitely a sipping beverage, but there is some balance in with the acidity and tartness.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Skøyen. Pours a shiny, deep gold colored body. No head, no carbonation. Massive apple aroma. Seducingly sweet, with notes of flowers and light honeyed malts. Big body. Juicy, almost syrupy texture. Delishiously sweet apple flavor, intense and genuine.  Warming silky apple nectar. Just awesome.

Corked bottle thanks to pushkinwow.  clear bright golden color, no carbonation.  Not much aroma, due to lack of carbonation.  Very sweet, fresh apple, sugary, light caramel, taste is reminiscent of apple pie.  Expensive, but a very nice dessert sipper.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2014 Bottle courtesy of Pontus (non-RB). Pours clear golden with a very small head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace. Smell is intense and very sweet with ripe red and green apples, blue cheese, hay, cloves, cinnamon, alcohol and ginger. Taste is intensely sweet and tiny sour with apples, apple jam, dry soil, lemon zest and ginger. Mouthfeel is sticky sweet, slightly tart and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and tiny sour with ripe apples, lemon zest, hay, marmalade, dry soil and some warming alcohol. Quite nice but nothing you drink a lot of. Re-rate! Thank you pushkinwow! Pours clear deep golden with no head. Smell is sweet, slightly acidic and heavy fruity with concentrated apple must, hay, blue cheese, ripe star fruit, dry soil and hints of alcohol and cinnamon. Taste is sweet, sour and very fruity with tons of mixed crushed apples both sweet and sour, hay, dry soil, ripe star fruit, ripe pineapple, moist wood and hints if apple brandy and cinnamon. Mouthfeel is extremely rich, sticky sweet, fruity tart, tiny boozy, viscous and near full bodied. Finish is sweet, sour and fruity with ripe apples, hay, lemon peal, alcohol, moist wood and hints if blue cheese. I feel I get this now. Extremely rich, balanced, complex and enjoyable.

Pours clear amber.  Aroma of fresh and baked apples, and some toffee.  Taste is tart, sharp, and sweet, with plenty of apples and a little toffee.  Feels sticky and sweet, with a full body.  Tasty stuff!

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2012 bottle, 13%. baked apple, light browned butter, pie batter nose; immensely rich and deep with layers of baked, spiced apple and honey.  difficult to put into words.  mulled mead, pepper phenols and sweet baked apple slices all over burying the malic acid. full body, highly sweet, immensely chewy texture perfectly match for acid, sweetness and body.   ridiculously rich and infinitely layered. SWEET DELICIOUS NECTAR.  better than any ice wine Ive had, and as good as the best port Ive had.  


10% bottle in 2009: rich, sweet, gritty, sticky, resinous and chewy... the honey, moderately tart red apple skin and light alcohol are phenomenal. thickness supports the sweetness, and the slight chemical and alcohol note over the middle is tempered and relieved by the tartness in the finish.

Pours a clear golden color with excellent legs.  Smells a little different.  A touch of butter and blue cheese, but also great apple and sugar characteristic.  Holy crap does this taste good.  Amazing apple flavor, tons of residual sugar sweetness but not cloying.  Very crisp.  Excellent body.  I need more of this.

Since drinking this Ive been pressing everyone to try it. I got it when visiting my parents for our farewell dinner. They have a few drinks a year, but both loved it. My Mom said it was the best drink shed ever tasted. I also think it was fantastic. Of course its very sweet but its not cloying, its more like apple pie. I guess this review is more intended for people who havent tried ice cider before who are thinking about picking it up... and my advice to you is, yes, get it. Your family/friends/date will be really impressed.
Bottle. Golden colour with no head. Aroma is apple, sugar, alcohol. Flavour is dry, sweet, sugar, alcohol, syrup. Full body. Lovely beverage i would like to drink again.

Beautiful bottle, first of all.  Attractive gold/amber pour.  Flat.  Aroma is pretty much apple, but its fantastic.  Taste is a fantastic balance of sweetness (which isnt cloying), tart apple, and even something ever so slightly bitter.  Mouthfeel is syrupy and glorious.  The 13% alcohol just warms everything up and makes it all the more cozy.  Very smooth.

Bottle split with vin, purchased from cellar 53. After having the dhiver version two nights ago at the ratebeer session courtesy of Ryan, I was surprised to find the premiere version two blocks away from my apartment.  Pours a hazy golden syrup with no head or lacing. Aroma is sweet apple sauce, fresh apple skins, cinnamon and crust. Mouthfeel is sweet and syrupy with notes of apple pie, apple sauce, cinnamon, some additional spices, and freshly cut apple skins. Fantastic cider which is only outdone. Y its dhiver version.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2015 Bottle with James, from James, thanks dude. Pours a clearish copper gold color with zero alcing and head. Aromas and taste of apple pie crust, apple skin, cinnamon sugar chunks, honey, booze, more sugars. Apple pie crust aromas gave way to the most dank tasting apple treat i have had. I enjoyed this cider immensely

Bottle. My first Ice Cider! How exciting! :-D Pours a clear, still light golden body. Aroma is intense, waxy tones of blue cheese and yeast. Hints of apples in the back. So strange, but not bad. When I take a sip, the whole experience is jacked into a high-voltage output - intensely semi-sweet apple tones spread out like a carpet, drilling an amazing multi-layered apple experience all over my unprepared tongue: apple juice concentrate, citric tones, hints of peaches and apricot. This is absolutely stunning. If someone slightly trustworthy would hand me this drink and tell me it was the sublime and true essence of APPLE I would buy that in a second. The blue cheese-like yeastiness comes back into play late in the palate, ensuring a smooth, strange and yet wonderful fade-out of the intense apple-ness. This most be a fantastic dessert companion, or maybe as a dessert itself. What a huge contrast between aroma and taste; the aroma was nice, but discreet. The taste: immense and easily recognizable, yet original at the same time. A great and unexpected taste experience for sure, and one I recommend anyone with a love for flavors to have for themselves. Sure the bottle is pricey, but this is definitely worth it. And more. :-)
Bottle. DArk yellow colour. Fantastic intense apple aroma. Great powerfull apple flavor. More sweet than dry. Long wonderfull powerfull finish. Excellent creamy palate. World Class.
summer apple aroma,yellow,golden, clear, light sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, soft carbonation, nice soft finish.NICE.
Clear yellow without head. Aroma is loads af sweet apples, wood and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet. Fairly dry finish. Very oily. Fantastic stuff.  140412

Medium yellow coloured and clear. Has no head. Aroma has lots of ripe apples, fermented, makaroon, light almond, heavy sweet. Flavor is heavy to harsh sweet, moderate acidic finish. Long-long duration. Full body. Syrupy texture, flat.
Bottle. Clear deep golden with no head. Aroma is apples, little sulfur, intense, fruit and rich. Flavour is apples, thick, rich, intense, medium sweet, fruit and a little citric.
Bottle from Vinmonopolet. No head. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich apples, appletrees, sugary notes and alcohol. Extremely powerful. Wonderful.

375 ml clear corked bottle in cardboard box, from Vinmonopolet, bestillingsutvalget. ABV is 13%. Deep golden colour. no carbonation. Intense aroma of oxidised cider apples, hints of oak (though apparently this ice cider has not been matured on oak). Intense and very concentrated and very sweet flavour of apples, dessert apples as well as cider apples. A very interesting and unusual cider, I have never tasted anything like it. Irresistably moreish. The price in Norway is ridiculously high, though.

bottle shared by ratman. pours a still clear orange brown body . strong ripe apple aroma. sweet sweet sweet apple flavor with some honey in the finish and a bit of hotness that lingers from the alcohol. mouthfeel is like a melted popsicle-or frozen ice things that i used to get as a kid and let melt and then drink down. a bit of cinnamon appears as this warms.

375 ml bottle. Thanx to Gunnfryd. Clear golden and a bit oily body with no head. Aroma of concentrated matured apples, smooth and not very strong but really obvious. Flavor is super sweet, matured apples in perfect balance with soft acidity and some kind of bitterness. Warming alcohol saves this from being sticky sweet, feels more like some kind of noble sweet. Comparable with Eiswein. Full body, smooth and long aftertaste. Delicious.

375 ml clear bottle courtesy oif IrishBoy ( thanks Richard) poured a clear orange with no head (still). Aromas of candied apple, honey, light earthiness and a hint of cinnamon. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of candied apples, honey, light cinnamon and light earthiness with a crisp lingering honey apple finish.

Bottle.Pours deep golden. Aroma of candied apples, sugar, red and yellow apples, fruitiness, a hint of pear and caramel. Flavor is sweet and warming with some sourish apple notes. Full body. Wow this is just really good.

Bottle 375ml @ gunnfryd
Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma has notes of sour sweet apples, vanilla and a hint of alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light sour. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, thx gunnfryd. A still, dark golden drink, completely flat and headless. The aroma is intense, not super complex in any way, but with lots of apples, some sweetnes, orchard and a hint of cores. Caramel hints and some faint resemblance to Calvados as well. Full-bodied, lightly warming and superbly smooth on the palate. The flavor is equally good as the aroma, lots of apples, in a very concentrated way. Shite, this is just plain f..ing wonderful. Damn I love this. 120124

Bottle, enjoyed with my wife and various company over the holidays. This pours like a nice Sauternes, from the colour to the legs down the glass. Aroma is sweet apples, genuine ripe fruit, with hints of stems. Flavor is sweet intense apple with lighter notes of white grapes and maybe a little lychee. Sweet and sticky, viscous mouthfeel, with some acidity in the finish that lifts the palate and dries things out a little, preventing this from ever becoming cloying. Unique and fantastic!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Thanks to adneilsen for sharing - clear golden brown appearance - aroma is all juicy, bright, fully ripe apple, a light touch of spice - flavor has a lovely balance of sweet, slightly overripe apple and tart apple acidity - quite hard to describe - as if the essence of apple in its entirety has been distilled - lightly acidic punch of the end balances the high sweetness - quite nice.

375 mL 2007 bottle big thanks to Aaron for opening this.  Pour is clear orange with no head, aroma has notes of sour apple, some caramel, butterscotch, some booze in there as well but not terrible.  Taste is a mix of granny smith apples, some cooked apples hints of caramel, toffee, some slight warmth and alcohol, finishing fairly sweet.

Bottle @ Brandons house. Clear, light golden orange appearance with no head. Toasty apple, light toffee, clean vinous aroma. Thick syrupy, rich caramel, toasty apple, toffee, brown sugar, tart apple crisp flavor. Very nice.

Rating #2100. 2006 bottle from a trade with Boutip. Labeled La Face Cachée de la Pomme Neige Ice Cider - 12% abv. Pours clear dark golden color with no head. Aromas of apples and booze. Very sweet apple flavor with lots of alcohol. Thick and syrupy. A great dessert drink. Thanks Phil.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T_npwPiFZu

200 mL bottle courtesy of JulienHuxley. Thanks! Had this for dessert after Christmas dinner. Pours a clear copper color with no head but some legs. Aroma of intense apples... sweet, mealy, syrupy and tart, brown sugar and vanilla. The taste is concentrated apple, both sweet and tart, apple skins, brown sugar, pear, pineapple and a light bitterness. Medium bodied. Very nice.

Pours a beautiful clear golden color.  Aroma of apples, of course.  Flavor is like sugary apple juice concentrate, with a slight touch of alcohol.  A great tasting ice cider, and fairly easy to obtain!
Bottle, thanks to slovak sniper. Very nice offering. It has a great aroma of apples and sweet sugars. the taste is very smooth. It has a nice finish a good body. It is a really nice one

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2011 Refrigerated bottle poured into a white wine glass.  Pours clear golden with no head.  No lacing, medium body, no carbonation, and apple aroma with a hint ot alcohol in the beginning.  Taste is slightly sweet apple and some alcohol comes through.

(37.5 cl, 2009)  Le liquide a une robe bien dorée.  Au nez, les pommes sont intenses : un très beau parfum de gelée avec une petite touche de fruits jaunes.  Lalcool simmisce dans la conversation.  Les saveurs sont caressantes pour les papilles avec une bonne dose de sucre et une touche justement acide.  Les pommes sont coulantes et moelleuses, un jus confortablement touché par les fleurs de pommiers.  En bouche, le liquide est tout en rondeur avec une silhouette élégante et suave.  La finale est un concerto de bonnes manières avec des pommes mordantes, de leau dérable et quelques épices.  Délicieux et réconfortant après une journée dans les bois.

Pour golden yellow. Aroma sweet apple with hint of booze. Taste a balance of tart and sweet apple with terrific a taste and a hint of alcohol. MF slick medium body pretty mute carb. Overall extremely well done and not sickly sweet a tasty one indeed. Thanks Slovaksniper!!!
Thanks Doug! The nose was amazing, spiced apple cider and apple sauce. Taste was crisp, juicy apples. Finish was sweet. Straight forward and really very nice.

I tried to keep an open mind with this. The first thing you notice is the bold aroma of apple and alcohol. The taste was the same, but blended better than I expected. I also detected hints of wood that added to the flavor of the tart finish.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Sampled from the bottle. Poured a clear golden yellow with no head whatsoever. Aroma is quite sweet with sweet apples, a bit of a candied note and a balance coming from . Flavor is quite sweet with candied/baked apple balanced by a slight tartness that comes out in the finish. Extremely smooth and goes down smoothly.

Nice golden pour. Just the colour youd expect from hyper concentrated apple juice. Very sweet purfumed apple and honey on the nose. Very sweet entry that slides away with the acid through the finish. Doesnt leave that cloying honey mouth that so many drinks in this style do.

Thanks to zdk for sharing a bottle. Pours clear gold with no head. Aroma is of ripe fruit, apples, pear, honey, caramel. Taste is fairly sweet, but also has a light tartness that balances it out quite nicely. Fairly thick with just a hint of alcohol. Sweet apple finish. Delicious.

Small bottle from the Ice Cider shop. Pours a clear bright golden color with a sticky run of legs down the glass. A wonderful bursting apple nose, soft sweet apples. The flavor is warm and great; aggressive sweet flavors of apples, some tartness, woody almost, a candy like quality, the the naturalness of the flavor is undisputed. Not complex, but damn good.

375 ml bottle via trade - Pours a clear golden color with no head.  Taste and aroma is lightly sweetened apples.  The alcohol is slightly noticeable.  This stuff really coats the tongue.  Medium to full body.  Very nice.

Bottle at Mes Tasting. Pours clear, rich gold. Huge, rich apple sauce aroma. Quite sweet, lots of apples, caramelized sugar, tons of apple sauce, very mild booze. Full in body, no carbonation, a touch syrupy. Somewhat warming on the finish with more apple sauce, spices, crumb cake. Delicious, potent, wonderful.

bottle: huge arouma, sweet fruit juices, huge apple tart. candied apple caramel. light sourness that balanced perfectly with the sweet fruit sugars. hint of booze at the finish with a touch of carbonic tartness. some mineral notes. silky, smooth body sweet mouthfeel. tart sugars linger lovingly on the tongue.

Bottle.  Pours a ruby and amber tinged cognac like color.  Big sweet apples, caramel and vanilla.  The aromas are just so deep and complex.  Thick, smooth and lovely bit of acid over apple syrup with some tang.  This was amazing.  Lingering tart apple butter and honey flavors on the finish.

Traded bottle on New Years. 1st Ice Wine! I thought it would remind me if eiswein but it has a bit more depth to it. Aroma was basically soft apples with the flavor a great mix of tart and sweet. Also some spice to make it interesting. Pretty cool. Thanks Tyler.

Aroma is sweet apple notes and some slight wood in there as well. Has no head, but ice ciders arent supposed to have head, are they? Okay gold-orange body. Flavour is muddy and sugary with excessive sweetness and not enough flavour showing through. Wet finish. Far too syrupy and simple for my liking.

Pours a beautiful golden with little to no head. Aroma is totally dominated by fresh apples. It smells as if you were lost in an apple orchard! Taste is a nice warming apple, with well hidden alcohol. This was a fantastic drink!

From a bottle at Longman & Eagle. An excellent find!. Pours a very still gold. Nose is fantastic. Fresh apples, braeburns and Jonagold. On taste, it is the absolute essence of the apples. Not just fermented apple juice, but a brilliant and fresh beverage. No alcohol to be found. Nice and full body. Theres not much else to say, except that it is pure apple. Fantastic.
bottle thanks to Savvy1982, pours still light yellow, tart apple aroma with hints of alcohol.  Flavor is very sweet apple, mild tartness follows, mellow alcohol finish.

(50 ml "miniature" from Tullys) Pours deep bronze-gold, mostly clear and bright. Very slight fizzy head. Aroma of fresh-baked apple pie, inside of the old cider mill from when I was a kid, whole apples, slightly sour apple skin and yeast. Very, very inviting. Mouthfeel light, smooth, very light stickiness, very light tingly carbonation. Flavor of fresh sweet fresh whole apples and fresh apple pie with a beautiful yeasty freshness. Light alcohol warmth. Just an almost perfect taste. Great.

Bottle.  Pours a clear burnt orange with no head.  Aroma of tart apple, buttery cookies, and champagne.  Flavor of sweet sweet apple initially followed by lots of sweet apple pie.  An excellent cider, a nice slow sipper to enjoy!
8/4/9/4/16 [4.1/5]

tasted out of a porto glass. colour is an opaque pale amber. aroma is apples, cinnamon and a bit of nutmeg. taste is sweet apples, with a very nice balance of spices. a great aperitif, i enjoy ice ciders very much. not quite sure why this is on ratebeer though.

Pours a golden yellow with no head or carbonation.  A syrupy liquid.  Aroma is very sweet with apple.  Taste is amazing, sweet apple, sugary with soft alcoholic tones.  Something that I will definitely go back for.  Fantastic after dinner drink.

Rating #900.  375 ml bottle via trade with tytoanderso- thanks again, Tyler!  2005 vintage; there is another stamp on the bottle that said 1L080607 so I thought it was a 2007 at first, but 2005 was on the cork.  Pours a rich, clear gold with no visible carbonation or head.  The aroma is mostly fresh apples, with some sugar, wood, and alcoholic notes.  The flavor is a pretty much perfect sweet, tart, fresh apple taste.  Wow.  The 12% ABV is definitely apparent but not at all in a negative way; warming, and rounds it out nicely.  Feels like a mix of apple juice and wine on the palate- no carbonation, smooth, and a little sticky, and I like what the warming alcohol does to the chilled liquid.  This is my first experience with ice cider, and this is the best thing Ive ever had with the word cider attached.

Style tasting with Shawn who provided the Éternelle, I brought the rest
1) La Face Cachée de la Pomme Neige Éternelle 2006
2) La Face Cachée de la Pomme Neige Ice Cider 2005
3) Domaine Pinnacle Cidre de Glace Ice Cider 2007
4) Etienne Dupont Cidre De Givre Eis Cider 2005 
Deep golden hue (slightly darker than the1st) with very good oily legs. The aroma has a heavier phenolic and slight chemical component at first but the apple vapours seems fresher and brighter with a light woody and even slightly spicy nose. The taste is where this shines, a wonderful balance between tart and sweet, you can taste the whole apple here, flesh, fruit and even core. There is a hint of fusel alcohol but nothing that distracting. The mouth feel is aggressive and warming. This displays the apple character at a high level. My favorite of the tasting.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2010 Tried  1)la face de la pomme  neige eternelle 2006, 2) la face de la pomme neige 2005, 3) domaine pinnacle ice cider 2007, and 4) cidre de givre 2005 side by side by side....  


1) was received from glouglouburp through trade- thanks dany.  you da man.  2-4 graciously shared by bbb63-  thanks mike!  this was awesome.  


Appearance: 
1-3 are all very clear.   1 and 2 are a clear watery amber with 2 ever so slighly darker than 1.  3 was a clear golden yellow.  no head.  4 poured a hazy murky  pond water orange brown.  
 

more important stuff
1)  similar to 2.  more earthy, less tart.   found myself drinking this one the most.  kept coming back to it.  needed to get seconds of this.  the earthiest of the 4.  score: 4.1
2)  deep sweet apple goodness.  more tart than than 1.  both are solid.  more complex than 1.  The tartness really gives a nice layer to this.  tight.   score: 4.5
3) Most subtle of the 4 and the least sweet.   Think white grapes and white wine apple.  score: 3.7  
4)  sweetest of the 4.  stands out as being a lot different than the other three.  a caramel candied apple sugar sweetness.  nice. caramel, sweet aple crisp. The most different of the 4.  a lot of candy and caramel notes that were more present than the others.  some syrup and honey notes as well.  good stuff.  can see this going well with an apple stroodle (msp) or other apple dessert.  score 4.1

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. My first iced cider. Pale gold in colour and flat. Aromas are of Spartan apples, nutmeg and a bit of cinnamon. Sweet apple in the mouth, but balanced by some acidity and a mild spice component. Slick in the mouth, but not at all cloying. Definitely the point where icewine and cider meet. Very nice.

The wife and I had this at Joel Robuchons in Las Vegas, as the conclusion to an insanely good meal.  I wasnt exactly looking for a rating at this place, but when the sommelier suggested an ice cider to finish things off... well, I was pretty happy.  Pours a medium, thick gold.  Intense aromas of apple (of course) are accented by mango and guava.  Flavors are of apple and intense tropical fruits.  And it just lingers forever in your mouth.  Stunning stuff, and it says something when a 3 star Michelin restaurant is suggesting it as a way to finish a meal.  Really glad to try this one.

Wow, thanks Bruce!!  Sweet looking bottle and pours clear light orange; flat and still; super sweet apple aromas and equally as sweet going down; smooth, syrupy candy liquor; creamy apple pie; sweet, decadent, totally kick ass and a unique drinking experience; and I just saw this the other day at Full Throttle Bottles for $37!!

Bottle. [thanks boutip]
... served iced... vintage 2006
Pours clear golden with no head. Aroma is sweet, lots of green apples and light tartness. Light carbonation, great oily mouthfeel. Flavour begins very tart and zesty. Fresh green apples, sweetness and light oak. Vinious and the tartness balances the sweetness well.

Bottle shared by Rusty.  My first Ice Cider.  Thanks RC!  Thick, deep golden pour with no head.  Aroma is apples!  Yes, apples!  Flavor is apples!  But not just apples!  Condensed apple deliciousness.  There is no other way to describe it.  Simple, but amazing.

Honey gold amber, a rich hue and clear. Aroma has apple skins, is totally pure. Silky palate with residual sugar in end. Big flavors, quite complex with honey and lots of juiciness, pure apple like concentrated AJ on steroids. How is it so sweet without being cloying? Brilliant. Very smooth with mellow strength. I could drink a whole bottle myself.

Bottle courtesy of my Canadian Secret Santa -- many thanks!  Pours a syruppy golden color with no discernable head.  Rich in flavor and aroma with granny smith apples and alcohol.  Just as luxurious as the Eternelle, but slightly more tart.
Nbutler with the hookup! Rich golden pour. Sweet apple genius. Purely decadent. God I love ice ciders.
Golden with a vague white head. Apple aroma with fruit and yeast. Very sweet flavour of apple, sugar and fruit juice.

Bottle courtesy of cfrancis.  Poured a clear, light golden color with no head.  The aroma is powerful, full of green apple, light alcohol, and a slight phenol note.  Smooth syrupy mouth feel.   This is delicious, like biting into a tart apple, slightly acidic and almost Mead like.  Sugary notes throughout with a pretty sweet finish this ones definitely best in small quantities.  Yum!

Corked bottle; harvest 2006, 3 years oldDeep yellow color; a lot of micro bubbles cover the sides and bottom of the glass. The aroma is intense; there is some sour apple, jam, but also plastic (as often happens in ciders) and very light hazelnut, orchid flowers. Good mouthfeel, just sweet enough; concentrated fruit flavor, apricot jam, with a sharp acid background; the sweetness, acidity and alcohol are in good balance. Very interesting and complex.

rusty brought this out on 9/27/2009 since he hadnt already brought out enough ridiculous stuff!

thick pour with no head but incredible legs... filtered real apple juice color yellow-y brown with golden tints. 

initially, there is a distracting woody aroma similar to fresh seeds, twigs and cardboard. this blows off to reveal a blast of fresh squeezed apple juice, earth, green and a fruity tartness. very pure, crisp and comforting. 

the flavor follows... freshly squeezed apples reduced down to a smooth, thick, syrupy richness. it is sweet for sure but the natural tartness of the fruit balances it out perfectly. 

amazing! i want to pour this over hot foie gras and brown sugar pecan waffles! 9/4/9/5/18/4.5

Ok, so this is pretty hard to rate... This is definitely not beer. Nor is this cider. This a delicious liquor all on its own. Although given the context of rating ratebeer, it wont score as high as I would give it on say... rate liquor.com. 2006 vintage. Pours a pale yellow, reminiscent of apple juice. No head, just a hint of carbonation when swirled. The aroma is great. Apples, spice, residual sugar and many more notes. The flavor is like a sweet delicious apple bomb. Pow! It coats your tongue and glides elegantly down your throat. The flavor is very complex, a great mix of sweet and sour. I would have never guessed that this was 12% abv. My score on ratebeer.com:4, my score on hypothetical rateliquor.com 4.5. Very, very nice!

Golden amber colour. Some very small bubbles frrom carbonation.  Very nice apple aroma, Sweet and pleasant. Flavour is very sweet and fruity. Very strong apple flavour. Very good cider. Supried by the carbonation.
courtesy of tytoanderso pours a nice gold aroma is fresh apple orchard. flavor is ripe apples light sweetness and a nice medium mouthfeel. fantastic cider wow.

Bottle many thanks to mes, this was only a 5cl bottle and im guessing it was a bit old. Im thinking that a newer and bigger bottle would have been better. Alround rating: Tart ta tan, brown sugar coated apples, some signs of oxidation makes the alcohol come out a bit, lightly peppery, but the appley sweetness and creamy character is just awsome. One of those drinks you just want more and more of.

50 ml bottle. Superb golden orange, lots of legs on the glass. Aroma: Juicy apple, caramel, alcohol, grapes, candy, tart - amazing. Flavour: SUPERB - creamy overripe apples, spice, slight alcohol, cinnamon, cane sugar, malty with a lovely long red apple finish - just superb, most definitely the best cider Ive ever had.
