Aroma is white wine, grapes, a lot of vanilla as well as some sour apples. Flavour is sweet sugary mixed with white wine. Mindblowing complexity, even though the sugary notes are a bit too sweet.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2009 Clean, crisp golden color with an aroma of apple juice. There were also some slight sour notes, maybe from green apples. Taste is the freshest of apple juice on steroids. Very smooth with some sour and tart flavors. This is really good.

Thanks to Central Market Fort Worth for managing to put this lost relic on the shelf.  It was so old, it wasnt in their system when I asked about a price, ha!  Anyway, pours deep gold, very close to orange with no head (its not supposed to have a head).  Aroma challenges my nose bigtime.  Applejuice, wood, sauteed apples (in cinnemon), pie crust, earth, and something very close to grass and hay.  Tastes  like a sweet syupy apple juice, with wood, cinnemon, butterscotch, candy coating, and is more sweet than tart.  Finishes a bit cloying and clean of flavor.  The wood and the sugar remain on the mouth while the tongue tastes the apples, but its a subtle finish.  Sticky body, but not as viscous or thick as a port.  You can take big sips if you want.  Very strange aroma, but decent flavor.  This is the gentlemans apple juice, but it reminds me too much of the apple juice I drank as a kid.  Oh yeah, my bottle is 10% abv.

2005 dated cork. Sweet juicy apple aroma.  Deep clear gold with no head and no carbonation. Mellow sweet, sour, tart, intense warm apple/pear taste explosion. Reminds me of Applewood ice cider liquer and pear port.

375ml bottle from trade with BMAN. Thanks. Year 2004 imprinted on the cork. Pours a pinkish-gold color with no head. The aroma is very woody with a cork, spices, and a bit of vinegar. The taste is much better than the aroma, there are complex apples, lots of sugar, spice and a bit of wood. The mouthfeel is full and syrupy, no carbonation. The finish is long and sweet. Overall: I think this bottle was starting to go to cork; the nose was way weird, but the flavor was good. Must retry sometime again.

Bottle pours crystal clear 24 K gold.  The aroma filled the room and my 13 old son came running to taste it.  This thing has legs in my tulip.  The flavor is intense apple and sweetness, balanced by some sour.  Just hard to describe and amazing.  The palate is slick, smooth, and beautiful.  Overall, this is amazing.

@Jimmacks pre BeerWars Gathering-375ml bottlepours with no head and yellow color.  Aroma is perfumy, apple/white grape, spice-clove/cinnamon.  Taste is sweet/sugary apple/white grape, some spice-clove/cinnamon.
Golden with no head. Aroma of applejuice, with hints of pear. Intense sweet apple flavour balanced by fruity tartness and a hint of alcohol.

Flaske: Flot dybgul tykflydende cider. Ingen karbonering. Kraftig duft af spiseæbler. Esktrem delikat sur æblemsag bakket op af sødme og alkohol. Dessertvin kommer tæt på, men samtidig gør surheden at den er drikbar i større mængder.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2009 Man is this good. Beautiful crystal yellow clear with nice legs. Aroma is crisp juicy apples and honey. Taste is sweet, honeydew, honey, crisp apple and a hint of spice or pepper back. Some alcohol, this is so good.

Bottle 375ml. @ [ Ulfborg Tasting ]. [ Vintage 2006 ]. Clear medium yellow orange color with virtually none head. Aroma is apple, wood , rubber, gum. Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate acidic - bitter with a long duration. Body is medium to full, texture is syrupy - oily, carbonation is flat, finish is light alcoholic. [20090114]

Botella, huge thanks to Pinball for sharing this great ice cider! Clear deep golden colour. Lovely pure fresh squeezed sweet aroma. Great filling mouthfeel. Sweet lovely concentrated fresh apple flavour with mild alcohol  and a nice sour tingeling touch. Long lasting sweet fresh pure apple finish. Home run!

Bottle shared by Pinball. 
Pours golden with no head. 
Aroma is delicious sweet apples with notes of alcohol and blue cheese. 
Flavor is sweet ripe apples, with a slightly acidic but pleasant aftertaste.

Bottle kindly shared by Pinball. Thanks Dennis. Clear golden yellow with almost no head. Aroma is fresh apples added a little vinegar that balances it out very well. Fantastic flavour of heavily concentrated sweet apples. Its crispy and cheesy. Wow. Must work perfect to a not too sweet dessert. The smooth palate makes the apple flavours explode in your mouth.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2009 orange, almost no head. 
well balanced aroma of fresh apple, also some acidity  vineagra in the aroma. 
flavor is fresh apple, slight acidity, faint citrussy notes, alc. totally hidden. 

this is a "you have to taste it" cider. its very different from any other ciders ive tasted, and the flavor is nothing short of fantastic.
Bottle from Glouglouburp. Thanks Dany! Nose of apple and blue cheese. Tastes of blue cheese, baked apple, carmel, honey. Finishes sweet and then with a tart after-taste. Really wonderful stuff.

Bottle from Global Wine & Spirits.  Crystal clear gold.  Nose is apples, honey, light alcohol, some gree grape fruitiness.  Flavor is sweet & tart apples, some tannins, honey, grapes, maybe a bit of raisin richness.  Alcohol comes out in the honeyed finish.

[Bottle] shared at Skyviews Lex/Larp Cellars Farewell. Pours a clear, glowing golden with a couple bubbles and nice legs. Aroma is sweet and tart apples, reminiscent of granny smith. Flavor is sweet and syrupy apple, quite tart, buttery, and little to no alcohol noted.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 Bottle, 12%. Sweet and citric fresh apple aroma. Clear golden colour. Thick, syrupy, sugary mouthfeel. The flavour is quite sweet, combined with citric apple, and a good alcohol level. Tastes like canned or pickled apple, concentrated in some way. Flat, no carbonation, and no head. The aftertaste has some concentrated apple juice, quite nice. 7 3 7 3 15 

Bottle, 12.5%. Good sweet apple aroma. Clear dark golden colour. Very flavourful. Very flavourful, citric, very sweet and very good. 9 4 9 4 18

Acheté à la SAQ en format de 375ml millésimé 2006 et dégusté dans un verre du 10e anniversaire de dieu du ciel. Apparence jaune orangé avec de fine particule de gazéfication et à lapparence très dense. Arômes de purée de pomme avec un peu dananas, de banane, de poire, de sucre brun avec une touche de gingembre, bref une tarte au pomme. Goût de pomme,de sel avec un trait de sirop dérable. Un bel équilibre, corp et texture en bouche. Un classic et une référence en terme de qualité et prix, un superbe prodiuit.

What a treat! Unspectacular bronze colored with a thin head. Aroma of candi and caramel apple with some honeyed notes. However, the flavor pops with sugary caramelized apple, assaulting the palate with a new and delightful breadth of gustatory experiences. Deliciously sweet and desserty, but never seems cloying. This is definitely one of those fermentables to see out and cellar away for special occasions.

200ml bottle poured into a wine glass.  Ive been wanting to try this one for a while.  Thanks to french tickler for this 2006 bottle.  This cider pours honey-colored and without the slightest hint of haze.  There are small round perfectly clear bubbles riding on top along the rim.  The aroma has apple, of course, along with a touch of brown sugar, olive oil and a cross between pineapple and asparagus.  The body is thick and coating and has a consistency like apple meat liquefied.  There is a noticeable alcohol bite at the end.  The taste is very tart at first but a thick stream of sweetness quickly rushes in to even things out.  This is an extremely well-balanced cider.  Everything is smooth and tasty.  This drink deserves its high rating.

Courtesy of Fonefan. It is a vintage 2006 and now its January 2009. The color is beautiful, warm orange-golden and the aroma has notes of apple, oven baked apples, syrup and light spice. The flavour has sweetness and it is very complex and delicious. If I were to chose between this one and Etienne Dupont Cidre de Givre Ice Cider, I would chose the latter.

Récolte 2005.  Bouteille de 220ml.  Dégusté dans un verre allongé (Blanche de Chambly) pour mieux décortiquer les arômes qui se cache dans cette creation majestueuse.  Couleur OR avec de fine petit bulles qui colle tres bien au verre.  Aromes de pomme caramelisée, un bon mélange de banane, poire et une finition tres subtile dalcool.  Une boisson dune rondeur et complexité extraordinaire... Sensation vélouté et quelque peu huileuse en meme temps.  Nous ressentons également quelques fine particule en bouche.  Tarte au pomme dantan, mince touche de cannelle, la poire reviens toucher nos papilles gustatives.  Ce cidre est dune qualité exceptionnelle et dun equilibre extraordinaire.  A dégusté a la temperature de la piece.

375 ml bottle opened to ring in the New Year 2009, after spending just over a year in my cellar.

Deep golden orange pour. Enormous and intensely concentrated apple syrup flavor, just absolutely delightful. Easy to see why this is averaging a 4.15 on the site: it deserves it.  What a glorious concoction.
(200ml bottle, 2005 vintage)  Pours a clear golden body with descent legs.  Aroma of apple, sugar, and mustiness.  Flavor of apple, honey, and light wood in the background.

Pours bright gold from the bottle.  Aroma of crisp apples.  Flavor is smooth, refreshing, and initially quite a blast of apple.  I tasted some tartness in the finish, to go along with some alcohol.  This being only my second ice cider, I am still not one to judge.  But this was incredibly tasty.  I even liked how the tangy finish lent balance to the otherwise dessert like treat of ice cider!

Bottle from Champane Wine, Warren, MI.

Poured pale color with a minimall head that diminished quickly with minimal lacing. Heavy sweet apple aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Flavor of tart apple with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration.

Went well with my cigar.
Bottle at pauls and also at la face.  Pours a pale yellow scotch reminicent body with no carbonation.  Big sweet apple, carmalized sweet apple syrup.  A note of vanilla.  Excellent.

From a 25 cl bottle courtesy of puzzl this poured light yellow with not much head and no lacing. Nose of apple.and sugar with some other odors. Alcohol maybe.   Sweet mouthfeel and incredible flavor.   Long lasting sweet finish. There was not much here to drink, but what there was fantastic.
2005 bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  light yellow pour with no head. great nose of apple, syrup and alcohol.  smooth flavor of apple and some vanilla.
bottle,thanks to bu11zeye,  golden green color, no head apparent, nice legs, aroma of musty fruit, amazing flavors of honey, syrup and apples, long lasting finish as if you had eaten the honeycomb

Its hardly fair to rate this side by side with beers, but Ill try. Clear yellow orange with no head, obviously. Sweet aroma and flavor, apple with honeyish syrup quality. Very pure extracted apple essence. Completely different experience from drinking beer or wine. Really cool to get to try this, I got the set with the 200ml bottle that came with two glasses, so it didnt last very long. Next time Ill definitely pick up the 1L bottle.

Bottles from Beerlando and Red, White, and Brew in Mt. Holly NJ. - thanks!  Nice golden color with solid legs.  Aroma of rich apples, a bit of honey and brown sugar, and some light alcohol.  Flavor is wonderfully sweet with ripe, sugary apples, sugary syrup, and a crisp acidity that is awesome.  Fantastic beverage!

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2015 Bottle at EBF ...  One of the Mikkeller gang brougth this... And my thanks to one and all for allowing me to sneak in and try this... This could well be my Highlight of the Festival  Pale Pale Pale yellow .. stunningly sweet apple nose ... "Bramly apple pie just like Mummy used to make"... Oh the flavour in intense... sweet insane apples ....

Bottle that the Mikkeller gang brought along to share, cheers for invitng me over Henrikb   Really stcky and sweet but quite wonderful. Very good tang its so concentrated makes you feel like it should be watered down. Lovely fresh sliced apples, quite incredible and so full flavoured, feel very fortunate to have this and the Dark Lord right after each other.

2005 Vintage 375ml via in person trade with glougoburb.  Thanks Dany, shared with my girlfriend Cyn and my friend Steve who loves cider and recently got his masters.  Pour golden orange with no head.  Nose is sweet and very nice with lots of flavor.  Taste is sweet, with a ridiculous amount of apple flavor and overall a wonderful full flavored experience thats slightly boozy but all in all not compared to the alcohol it acutally has.  Excellent.
Golden. Big candied apple pie nose with the spices. Medium-full bodied, delectable apple flavor meshing with the alcohol warmth, spices, Starts sweet with balancing apple tartness. Just fantastic.

bottle- enjoyed with wife for wedding anniversary. extremely clear, with some very fine particulate matter that you can see when you hold the cider up to the light. very fine carbonation that fades quickly. apple aroma hits immediately and welcome you in. quite something- very cloyingly sweet, apple candy flavor. Alcohol really no where to be seen due to residual sweetness...only shows its face as cider warms to near room temp. Very small bottle, very expensive, and very tasty. A recommendation for a special occassion.

375mL bottle from the LCBO (I know? Right?!?). So for $29.95 this had better not disappoint, and it doesnt. However it still has give me one hell of a fun and wild and messy time. So apparently Im terrible at removing corks that dont stick out of the bottle at all. Damn. Anyways, this deep gold liquid decants nicely into my snifter, and DAMN check out those legs! Sexy. Incredibly moderate carbonation also, which kind of surprised me. Aroma is like getting punched in the face by some enraged apple-picking labourer with a sack of freshly picked apples, but for some reason you love it? The flavour is like that again, but even harder. Starts out unbelievably sweet, like some sort of apple orgy in your mouth, and then to balance the whole show out youre hit with some really nice sour tartness. Sour green apples, maybe a hint of apple crumble, but mainly just a ridiculous amount of apple goodness. Damn, this stuff is intense, and delicious. Very nice drinking experience, and apparently I have to finish the whole thing now because I sort of destroyed the cork. The alcohol is very well hidden in amidst the abundant flavour. Having lived in Quebec for 5 years as a kid, I can say that if the Quebecois winer had a flavour, this would be it. No matter how bizarre that sounds you know its true.

Thanks to iowaherkeye for bringing this bottle to his farewell to Iowa tasting. Very inviting aroma of buttery caramel, apple, and a splash of raw, but not unpleasant, alcohol.  Sweet with a slick, oily mouth feel and a nice warming alcohol effect. Tasted of apple pie, sweet cream, caramel apple, buttered corn bread, and a splash of apple juice. Wow, I cant wait to pick up a couple six bottles of this stuff.

thanks goes out to iowaherkeye for this one.  Amber pour with a thin white head.  Huge apple and strawberry jam aroma.  Flavor was more sweet apple with just a bit of tartness that doesn’t come close to balancing how sweet this is.  Very nice in small doses.

[1398-20080530] Bottle. Muted apples and sugary apple powder aroma. Clear, light orange yellow body with no head. Light sweet apple flavour has a few sugary tart hints. Medium body has a bit of dry mushiness. Good.
(3/5T @ Mondial; Montreal, QC)
Pours clear, yellow, with no head. Aroma is delicate and fruity. Very sweet, pleasantly acidic and tingly. Fuckin’ great!

Bottle received via trade with Glouglouburp.  Pours sparkling dark yellow with no head, thus no lacing.  Aroma is average malt (hay, straw), light hops (grass), light yeast (earth) with notes of apple.  Medium bodied, slick texture, soft carbonation, and a sweet finish.  Average duration, moderate sweetness, light acidity and bitterness.

375ml bottle from glouglouburp. Pours clear yellow, no head. Smells like concentrated sweet apple juice. Tastes like smooth, concentrated apple juice. Sweet, slightly fermented/rotten and some alcohol. Full, sygary sweet body, no carbonation. Awesome! If you haven’t tried it, do it.

RB#5400: 5 cL bottle, thanks to Ungstrup. Pours clear and deep golden yellow to orange, no head. Dense apple aroma, sweet and phenol at once - almost mead like. Flavour starts sweet and reveals a solid apple authentic flavour with load of floral elements and phenol. Smooth and warming at once, light sugarish. Citric into the finish - light shivering :)

Pours a thick golden color.  Aroma is of cellared apples and spice.  Flavor is this fantastic mix of sweet and tart, like a lover slapping you in the face and then kissing it all better.  Wow.  Very sweet on the backend and if I was going to fault it for anything, I’d say it’s just a bit to sweet, but like other ice ciders I’ve tried, I was tipping the bottle upside down over my tongue to get the last drop.

Bottle, from Holiday Wine.  It was tough plopping down $30 for this, but I had the Éternelle a few weeks back and loved it.  This, while not nearly as good as the Éternelle, was still very good.  Nice vibrant golden color. Very sweet apple flavor, bordering on too sweet.  Lots going on.  Fresh baked apples, cinnamon, clove, oak, caramel, etc.   Mouthfeel was oddly oily and thick.  A fine beverage, but too sweet for me.  A definite sipper.

Bright yellow golden color. Nice tall legs. Apples, biscuits, mild resin and apple skin scents. Fairly sweet and nothing too unusual in the nose. Fairly thick in feel, but there is enough tartness to help cut through any syrupy characteristics. LIght sweet apples i the front. I do catch an early touch of resin again, but only faintly. Pure baked apples, with caramelized sugar and hint of cinnamon. A touch of tartness sneaks in every once and awhile to help this one from getting cloying and thick. A wonderful dessert.

Bottle 50 cl. Served cold in a lambic-glass alá cantillion- has a light and hazy golden appearance with wide curtains when you twist it. No carbonation at all. The nose is filled with millions of apples. The taste is deep deep deep round applelike with an oily palate that is almost syrup-like. It has a long lasting fruity finish.

50 ml bottle thanks to HogtownHarry- Deep gold pour. Has aromas of very fresh apples (green, mcintosh), and subtle spices. The nose is just mainly fresh apples though, and that in itself is not bad. This smells very "fresh". The flavour profile is way more complex. Sweet fresh apple juice with a touch of vanilla and caramel, leading to dark fruit and pear. Ha, a cider that produces other fruit flavours! I love it! This is quite complex and has a neat bitter finish that reminds me of appleskin, but it is also sweet and syrupy, and lingers for ages. Excellent. Thanks Harry! Much appreciated!

Right up my alley.  Clear yellow, with mellowed sweetness and a great apply dynamic--more strongly apple than some of their other varieties (Neige Eternelle, Inspiration).  Smooth with a sweet finish.  Wonderful sipping but probably best in sharply limited quantities. (Montreal Beer Festival, 2008).

375ml bottle, 2004.  Pours a luminous golden color that really jumps out at you, no head.  Aromas of green apples, intense sweetness, and crab apple.  Flavor is an excellent marriage of sweet candied apples (apple tart?) and the sourness of green/crab apples.  The finish is refreshing in a way similar to unpasteurized apple cider fresh from the press.  I have never before tasted a cider with this depth of flavor.  You can really taste Quebecs winter!!
Bottle of the 2004.  Deep amber color.  Pure apple aroma with almost a hint of citrus from the bracing acidity, which balances the sticky sweetness perfectly.  Delightful.

375 ml bottle courtesy of trade with Glouglouburp, thanks! 2005 vintage. Sweet aroma, with a hint of alcohol. Taste was a delicate balance of tart and sweet, very nice. Bit of a syrupy mouth feel which I loved. I love cider, and this took my appreciation to another level. Outstanding.

Poured from a 375 ml bottle.  2005.  Clear, magnifying gold appearance.  Pure powdered sugar and caramelized apple aroma, piled high with a maple glaze on crusty, egg custard french toast.  It has a really pure, floral perfume quality about it that cuts through that sweetness the loveliest of soft touch.  Apple flavor vibrant, luxurious and dense; washed warmly in honey, vanilla, maple, and general pristine polish.  Never seems to push much candied flavor or sugary grit in place of this pure, angelic apple essence.  Glowing middle of maple syrup and pear.  Full palate is pillowy and oily, showing a sharp twang of sugar only briefly; generous, lush fruit flesh unfolding with gorgeous length ; reticent, warm, regal sweetness finishes.  The clarity and depth of this medley of fruit character is wholly stunning.  Beautifully rendered; all possibilities realized.

375 ml. 2005.  Exquisite on  the nose. Crushed tart and sweet apples.  All of the good thing about apples are apparent in this cider. Lightly tart. Plenty of dense apple meat. Juicy, sweet, lush, oily, rich. Damn. Thanks Eben!

Clear golden with no head. Cold aroma of apple, not cider, apple. Has a bit of alcohol in the aroma also. Nice tasting, again not really cidery, but like actual apples. Sweet and juicy with a little bit of tart like my favourite apple, the McIntosh. Only flaw is a bit more alcohol than I would like.

Clear golden colour with a very small white head. Sweet, intense apple fruity aroma with wood notes. Wellbalanced apple fruity flavor with a vague alcohol note. Light dry, fruity finish with notes of oak.

Bottle, shared by kmweaver.  Pours a clear yellow gold.  Honey and fresh apple crisp chips on the nose with a touch of alcohol.  The flavor is fresh crisp apples, lots of McIntosh especially with skins and seeds.  Minimal alcohol flavor on the finish.  Sweet, but not overly so.  Mouthfeel is smooth and slightly sticky with a nice lingering lasting finish.  Overall, just a really wonderful cider.

Thanks to Ken for this one.  Clear yellow color.  Fresh apple aroma, tanginess, apple skins, sweet deliciousness.  Flavor is an amazing sweet dry apple sour with a slight amount of syrup textire to fill out the body.  Oh my god, I love this.

Courtesy beastiefan2k. This one poured a clear light peach color with a very thick looking still body. The aroma is one to be savored of fresh apples of the variety of sweet mcintosh and tart granny smith. Smells of sweet candy sugar, candied apples, and hints of alcohol also make themselves present. The flavor follows suit with the blend of sweet apples and candied sugar pushing through first follwed by the tartness of some granny smith flavors. The flavor is truly decadent on a dessert level. It has a full bodied mouthfeel that is very smooth and viscous that goes down so easily with sweet/tart apple flavor left behind and a touch of alcohol warmth. This is one amazing cider, and one that I wish was more accessible so I could enjoy it o more occasions.

Extremely good cider! Aroma is sweet Apples (obviously) with some alcohol, cinnamon and another aroma which is nearly like a nice stilton (not in a bad way, but very different). Nice golden color, and you can see sheets of the liquid running down the glass. Taste is amazing. It starts sweet and then follows up with a nice bitterness that brings everything into a perfect balance. Syrupy mouthfeel. Really pleasant, but extremely expensive.

Big thanks to Bman1113VR for bringing this to my recent tasting. Pours a honey yellow color with almost no head which is not surprising for a cider. Nose is of blue cheese (stilton?) and a bit of sweet apples. Taste is very sweet and the alcohol content is hidden very well. A truly great cider that is amazingly complex in both aroma and taste.

Bottle from SAQ in Montreal.  Nice golden yellow.  Pleasant aroma of apples, caramel, some tartness, almost a light reisling like aroma.  Nice, not overpowering.  Taste is good - lots of intense alcohol, sweet caramelized apples, cinnamon, almost like a strong apple crisp.  A little too tart - doesnt always mix perfectly with the sweetness.  I thought it was a great sipper after dinner on Valentines Day with my wife, just not extraordinary.

Bottle via trade with MrManning - thanks very much, Len! Bright golden hue, like the colour of perfect sunshine. Absolutely stellar aroma of fresh, tart apples with a hint of caramel. Full bodied, very rich and slightly sticky. Full flavoured, lots of sweet apple off the top, with a great tartness and slight acidity coming through to keep things balanced. The alcohol pokes through a bit in the finish, but not nearly as much as it could for 12%. A complete joy to drink.

Purchased at a wine shop in Manhattan.  What a phenomenal letdown!!  I cannot put into words how much better I had hoped this would taste.  Essentially, its virtues are as follows - you cannot taste the 12% alcohol at all!  Not one bit.  No, seriously.  Now for the downside: Neige tastes like Motts apple juice.  No kidding.  Theres little in the way of complexity, and because its flat, you dont even get the enjoyment out of it that would come from a glass of Woodpecker Cider.  Very, very disappointing.  By the way, its not even all that sweet.  Its got about the same tartness as a can of MinuteMaid applejuice that youd get on a United flight.

2004 Bottle from boboski, thanks!  Enjoyed on Christmas Day.  Aroma very fruity, predominately sweet green apples.  Golden pour with no carbonation or head. Taste is very very sweet but not sugary and somehow not cloying.  Green apples, smoother and more natural than a jolly rancher, and clearly without any of the stickiness.  Full body with a light, gentle warming.  This sucker is smooooth!  Classy and developed, mature and seamlessly blended.  And hey, if you want to get someone drunk without them knowing it.

Thanks to Dave for sharing.
dark golden pour w/ some tiny on the glass bubbles and nice legs.  Smell of super sweet apples very sweet sugars hints of alcohol.  Palate is full rich and lightly creamy.  Flavor is very sweet sugars lots of apples some green apple skins almost a light spice in the finish that Id have to relate to a cinnamon.  Very sweet goodness.

2005 bottle.  Clear amber body with a light-bending viscosity to it.  The aroma is of ripe McIntosh apples and oddly enough, cinnamon.  Perhaps its the Spartan apples.  The flavor kicks in some tart yellow delicious skin alongside the existing apply sweetness.  No real alcohol burn.  Another fantastic cider!
200 ml bottle. Golden color with no head. Clear. Apple, apple, apple. Alcohol is well hidden but slightly noticeable at the end. Quebc cider at is best.

bottle....thanks to drewbeerme for sharing this tasty ice cider....poured a cystal clear and trasparent light apple cider brown with no head....aromas of tart and sweet candied apples and not much more than that but i wasnt expecting a very complex nose....flavors of sugary sweet apples.  very clean and extremely drinkable....a very nice, elegant, clean, crisp ice cider.

375 ml bottle.  Thanks to my Secret Festivus for the bottle.  Pours a crystal clear gold with no head.  The aroma is sweet apples.  The flavor very much reminds me of some of the better ice wines Ive had, only instead of grapes, the flavor is apple.  Rich and flavorful with just the right amount of sweetness.  The alcohol is gently warming near the finish.  Very enjoyable.

375ml bottle and a huge thanks to Glouglouburp for this extra! wow, an amazing extra. pours clear yellow with no head. nose of apples, earthy, and apple cores. flavor of sweet apples, apple core, and almost syrupy sweet. no alcohol is noticed in flavor and bascially warmth down the throat. this drinks like apple juice. amazing. everything is so clean and refined, extremely drinkable.

(Bottle 37,5 cl) Courtesy of Thomas_E. Clear, deep golden with no head whatsoever. Intense, sweetish apple aroma. Very full and rich body with these intense, sugary notes - apple syrup perhaps, perhaps even with a touch of cinnamon. Theres a vague, underlying acidity. Truly delicious. 191207
Bottle. Clear golden colour with no head. Great aroma of apple and juice. Sweet flavour with notes of apple and alcohol, very tasty and nice.

Rating #1200. Bottle. Big thanks to Radiomgb for sending this one to me. Nice golden body. Aroma is wood, apples. Flavor is sweet, tart apples, wood. Thick mouthfeel. Alcohol is undetected but sneaks up on you. Glad to have the chance to try this.

2005 vintage.  Pours a crystal clear light golden color.  The body is 99.9% still, though the occasional bubble escapes from the gathering that collects near the bottom of the cordial glass.  Though not as thick as its big brother, Frimas, the Neige sports syrupy legs that cling to the glass well, foreshadowing the inevitably luxurious mouthfeel.  The aroma boasts a full-on concentrated apple assault, with seemingly every variety of the fruit, from crisp Washington to tangy Granny Smith on full display.  The flavor follows suit exactly, though the concentration and tangy subtleties intensify.  A smooth, viscous, almost creamy mouthfeel borders on perfect, though falls just short (perhaps only because I know the Frimas is even more decadent).  This is truly awesome stuff that I would love to be able to have on a more frequent basis.  As it stands, I feel very fortunate that I am in a position to enjoy on special occasions.

2005 bottle shared with the wife as we tucked into a selection of Quebec cheeses. Pours a radiant gold, leaving frosting on the flute due to the cold temperature it should be served at. Sweet concentrated apple aroma. Flavour is unbelievably appley. So concentrated and delicious. Sweet, smooth and syrupy, but balanced by a nice tartness and dry finish. The alcohol is completely unoticeable. This paired really well with the cheese, and is superior to the icewines Ive tried.

2004 Bottle from thecheeseman.  Thanks Daniel!   Shared with the fam on christmas eve. Nose has a lot of honey, fresh apples, some floral characteristics.  Flavor is sweet with fresh pressed apples, honey,flowers, tart apple skins. Palate is silky smooth and it finishes dry.  Very nice, alcohol well hidden.

Bottled. Light yellow coloured. Uncleaer. Small white head. Very sweet and full of apple in the aroma. Has a somewhat nutty character. Flavour as well is nutty and full of freshly pressed apples. Has a light sweetness which is countered by a subtle sourness making this an incredible drinkingexperience. Medium to full bodied. Is very heavy in texture and on the palate. Has some light alcohol in the end, but again the apples wins this time with a nice sourness as well. Never knew cider could be this great.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2008 Bottle.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Sweet aroma of apples and almonds with a light acidity and notes of wood.
Sweet flavour of apples and almonds with some acidity and notes of wood and alcohol.
Very nice.

Bottle. [Another great tasting session @ Papsoe] Spare fizzy white head. Clear flat looking body with a golden color. Oily thick lacework. Aroma of fresh apple, melon, nuts. Heavy fresh apple over the palate with heavy sugary base. Medium to full bodied with a very dry and alcoholic texture and an average carbonation. Heavy sweet flavor with light acidic notes. Dry and sweet fruity finish. I would love to try this one with apple pie as papsoe said. 8 / 4 / 8 / 4 / 16

UPDATED: APR 9, 2009 In short: Archetypical classic Ice-Cider.  The measuring stick of the style.  Excellent.
How: Many times.  Lately I had the three Face Cachée de la Pomme classics (Neige, Neige Éternelle and Frimas) side by side at Montreals Flaveurs, Bières and Caprice Festival 2007.
The look: Golden-yellow body with no head.
In long: After 1300+ ratings heres my first ice-cider rating.  Almost shameful since I live in the land of ice-ciders.  I feel like a Texas fifth-grader whos not yet familiar with firearms.  Anyway very sweet with dominant flavours of apple skin (red apples mainly) and hard-candies.  Mouthfeel is oily and silky.  Surprisingly smooth.  The smoother of the Face Cachée lineup.  There really aintt that much to say about ice-ciders as they have a very linear and focussed flavour spectrum.  Excellent nonetheless.

Sampled from 50ml clear bottle. Medium gold colour. Strong sweet apple aroma. Flavour is initally sweet, fresh apple, a bit sugary, then has a tartness behind it. Medium, sticky mouthfeel. Very faint alcohol note, but blends in nicely. Maybe too small a sample, but this was great.

Bottle from Holiday Wine Cellar.  Tasted at Lost Abbey Older Viscosity Release.  Darker apple juice color.  Strong apple aroma.  Lots and lots of apple in aroma.  Very sweet, lots of apple flavor.  Alcohol is perfecty hidden beneath the sweetness.  A little bit of tartness, probably from the citric acid of the apples.  Great drink for a date.  Tastes almost exactly like apple juice.
piss yellow with no head.aroma is glue and grapes.flavor is cloyingly sweet with a bit of lemon.....strange.

Bottle courtesy after4ever. Pours clear pale orange with no head. Tart aroma of apples. Tart taste to match. This is like getting a couple of apples condensed into each sip. There is so much taste going on here that theres almost no way to discern how much alcohol is involved.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2012 Courtesy of after4ever and shared with after4ever and bitbucket. Pours a watery clear gold. The aroma is green and red delicious apples mixed with a copious amount of red apple skins and some faint chemical alcohol notes. The taste throws back the senses into a tail spin from the bitingly bold flavor. It starts very thick and viscous, nearly sludgy, carrying a bout load of apples followed by hints of alcohol. The flavor is highly concentrated-condensed apples. The alcohol does create an odd almost chemical note but it doesnt interfere with the experience much.
Another sampling of this.  Pours clear deep gold with impressive sludgy legginess. The aroma pushes up rich sweet apple nectar along with tart apple skin like tannins followed by a bit of chemical booze to almost a cotton ball sensation. The rich taste goes from slick apple nectar sweetness and runs straight into tart green apple juice notes. To midway and into the finish it lends out some booziness and then a bit more sweet sticky apple nectar sweetness. Dynamite.

375. Lighty caramelly golden brown--very delicate coloration, almost sparkles in the light. Headless and laceless of course, fair amount of leg showing against the side of the glass. Sharp green apple nose; tart fruit sugar and red apple in there as well. Light, vanishing presence on the tongue, along with a denser, more syrupy settling sensation on the floor of the mouth. Its like it breaks into lots of different little pieces in different parts of the mouth; some sugary, some puckery, some effervescent, some concentrated. Very dimensional apple presence at every stage. Long, sticky, sugary finish.
Aroma is very sweet, honey, apple syrup, green apples.  Taste is full and awesome, apples across the board, its like they condensed a cider down using a government shrink ray.
2005 bottle from robinvboyer; nose of apples and honey; translucent gold with no carbonation; flavor of tart apples, sugary sweetness, and light spices; body thick and syrupy1 Great cider!
Bottle: Pours a clear yellow with some legs to it. Aroma, sweet apples, sugary, some spicing, and some hints of overripe fruits. Flavor, spices, tart apples, sweet with some sugary notes, very nice.

Sample, at the Mondial de la bière 2007, savoured June 1 2007; eye: straw, clear, no effervescence; nose: aged apple, fruity, apple sauce; mouth: concentrated apples, apple sauce, velvety; overall: excellent

FRANÇAIS 

Échantillon, bue au Mondial de la bière 2007, savourée le 1er juin 2007; oeil : paille, claire, pas deffervescence; nez : pomme vieillie, fruitée, compote de pommes; bouche : pommes concentrées, compotes de pomme, velouté; en résumé : excellent

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2008 375 ml bottle. pours golden with a nice syrupy stickyness to the look. this baby has legs! a quick swirl coats the sides in a thick golden deliciousness. it took 3 mins for the sides to run down to the body of the cider. aromas are apple driven with hints of pear, honey and some spice. flavours are wonderful apple sweetness with a touch of spice finished with a touch of tartness. a wonderful drinking experience.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2010 Bottle:  (50 ml) The aroma is a combination of apples, white wine, a hint of honey, and faint alcohol.  Pours a transparent gold and really coats the glass.  There are few large bubbles that almost instantly disappear for a head.  The flavor starts with an intense sugary apple sweetness that quickly turns very tart and sour apple candy-like with some acidity in the finish.  There is a definite warming affect and very faint burn, but no alcohol flavor to speak of whatsoever.  There is the slightest hints of cinnamon in the finish.  Slick oily mouthfeel.  I was sort of let down by the aroma, but I love the intense flavor.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2008 What a way to start your Sunday morning!!! Pure golden yellow pour, oily, cordial like legs. Sweet and tart apples up front. Tons of residuel sugars. Very faint hint of spice. Flavor exactly as aroma would indicate. Tart apples up front, fades to sugary sweet apple pie through the middle, never finishes. Long lingering aftertaste. Silky smooth mouthfeel, at times syruppy, in a good way. Cant believe this is the 3rd best cider from them? Dangerously drinkable. In fact in a way I am glad its $32 a bottle, could definately lead to trouble.

375 ml bottle, 2005.  Clear gold, slightly paler than the rim of my flute.  No head.  A quick sniff yields sliced red toffee apple.  Pausing over the glass for a minute or so brought notes, no evocations, of all things apple.  Dances between pie, cobbler, sauce, fresh picked and orchard cider.  Hints of cinnamon.  A thin syrup that dissolves mercurially with tiny carb fireworks and a tongue numbing tang.  After 5 minutes of nasal foreplay the first sip is apple orgasm.   Ive had great apples but the saturation and complexity of the Neige is almost otherwordly.  Sweet and sour rise and fall and linger long with more subtle apple.  Incredible.

Pale gold. Still. Aroma of ultra concentrated sweet apple, lightly tart, spices, some musty earth. Dense, rich flavor of sweet apples with enough tartness and alcohol to make it drinkable. Subtle spice and earth also present. Full body, smooth, viscous, heavy, rich. Great dessert drink.

Drank from two combined 50ml bottles, although this is the 3rd or 4th time Ive had this. What a fantastic, fantastic drink. Viscous, leggy gold pour is laced with tart, crisp apple aroma, a touch of spice and gentle white wine acidity. Big potent flavor, starts off calm and grows to a truly impressive finish, a blistering blast of intense apple so rich it is almost overwhelming. And this isnt even as big as Frimas! Simply outstanding. And how many other drinks have you licking your lips long after youve finished them?

Bottle at LCRBM3.  Arrrh, time to bring a bit of sanity to the recent ratings.  Sweet apple pie aroma.  Bit of alcohol and butterscotch on the initial hit.  Thick in mouth.  Sweet apple juice.  Needs a bit of spice on the end perhaps to balance it, something like cinnamon or cloves, but it doesnt have this so it rather drifts off in the mouth.

Skyview is the man for sharing this.  Pours a nice light golden.  Killer concentrated applesauce like spicy sweet apple nose.  Nice tart and sweet nose with a killer dose of ripe fruit and cinnamon as well as some .  Some Granny smith meets a touch of macintosh with a light dose of cinnamon.  This is un-be-freaking-lievable!e
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text:
A Mes rate: 
Bottle at LCRBM3. Excellent presentation. Very tall slim bottle in a well designed canister. Thick gold, totally flat but clearly quite thick with the alcohol. Lines the glass really well. Very very sweet but so perfectly balanced with the sugary apples and some tart rhubarb type notes. Light spice and an aged dusty feel too. Alcohol is very restained considering its strength. Awesome sweet and puckery finish with definite cinnamon. Absolutely glorious.

Pours gold with no head at all. A couple of bubbles visible. Aroma of apples. Nice sweet and dry apple flavor with some spice hints. Extremely drinkable for 12%. Very smooth. Thanks Boutip for getting my hands on one!

Cool, long skinny bottle.   A clear bright gold liquid.  Aroma of, you guessed it, apples.  Some plastic and alcohol too.  No carbonation.  I would says that it lies dead in the glass but it does have some legs that creep up the sides of the glass.  Sweet and tart and amazingly succulent.  One little sip is making my mouth salivate like crazy.  Strong alcohol presence.  Loads of dry crisp apples and a bit of spices.  Or is that just the alcohol kicking in.  Little bit of lychee in there also.  bierkoning hit it right on the head.  Finishes smooth and alcoholic.  A damn good cider.  I wish I had more.  Thanks to etowneraser for sharing.

Aroma has apples and some weird smell I couldnt really determine, something pine/medicin like smell. Really special I must say. Clear, golden coloured, no head. Taste is very sweet with apples and some spicy touch. Bit liquor style. Nice, nice. Now I understand why one might like ciders.

2005 bottle, 3rd LCRBM. Apple pie and citrus in the aroma. Sour and syrupy. Very sweet but still perfectly balanced because of the fruity sourness. Citrus, lychee, pineapple, apple pie with a hint of cinnamon. The flavor is very close to perfection.

Fully pale gold colour, appealing. Musty, wild mushrooms like  trompettes de la mort  or even truffels! And apples, of course. Sweet, liqueurish taste, with again wild mushroom flavours, apples, malonic acid, blooming and explosing flavours, yet delicate. Alcoholic³, sticky MF. With little doubt, the very best cider Ive ever had the honour to taste. This is sheer genius!

Yellow/golden color, Very sweet, apples, cinnamon in the finish. Sticky, cloying, alcoholic. Unbelievable great and lovely.

#900.  Bottle sent as a bonus from a very generous Rastacouere.  Pours a bright yellow color.  Spiced cider like aroma with a touch of cinnamon notes.  Strong, musty apple flavor with an almost mulled spice flavor.  Pretty hot.  Exceptionally dry finish despite the sweetness throughout.
Clear golden-amber w/ no carbonation. Aroma of sweet apples, cheese, & brandy. Juicy, syrupy feel.. Apple pie & cheddar cheese flavour w/ a mild tartness & warm, brandyish finish.

been waiting awhile to try this. Pours a nice golden apple juice color.Aroma is of apple juice poured from a plastic bottle, sweet apple aroma.Ha s a huge apple flavor.Thus was way too easy to drink.The finish had s light burn.

One of the best ciders I have ever had.  It has a great apple aroma that has just a touch of cinnamon.  Sour green apple in the aroma as well.  Flavor has some sour natural apple flavor, and lots of sugar with light cinnamon.

Pours light golden, white wine color with no carbonation.  Aroma is apples, Christmas, apple juice, tiny bit of alcohol but not off-putting, especially considering the ABV.  Taste is smooth, delicious, surprisingly full-bodied in a nice way.  This rocks.  Alcohol has never tasted this good.  Crazy well hidden and drinkable.  I have little experience with cider but this certainly opened my eyes and interested me.  Great.

Recommended by chriso420 in Portland, Oregon during ABA 07 Beer Tour. Pours a rich golden orange beverage with no head. Body is thick, a little syrupy with a lot of aroma. Scent of sweet apples, earthy spices and a touch of butter. Texture is thick, creamy and soft with a strong taste of ripe Granny Smith apples just as they were freshly harvested from the Australian orchards. Finish is slightly tart with a cinnamin apple pie filling aftertaste. This ice cider is so amazing I could easily believe that every romance novelist has a few bottles of this next to their word processor. Where did I get this? Belmont Station in Portland, Oregon. Thanks again chriso420!

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2009 Rating #900.  Thanks to Skyview for sharing  the second gem of the evening.  Rich gold color with visible alcohol.  Amazing burnt toffee aroma with Granny smith apple flavor.  Strong apple flavor that dominates the burnt toffee I so enjoyed in the nose.  Truly a phenomenal cider that was still young - I need to find a bottle to toss in my cellar for a decade or so.

(bottle, Big thanks to Skyview for sharing this incredible cider!) The aroma was very strong and consisted of granny smith apples with a hint of cinnamon.  Taste contained an initial blast of sweetness which gave way to an amazing finish of tart apple with notes of cinnamon, butter, and brown sugar.  Just fantastic.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2008 [Bottle, huge thanks to Skyview for this] By far the best cider that I have ever tasted.  Strong aroma of green apples.  Super smooth, sweet, but a little tart too.  Despite being 12% there were no signs of alcohol anywhere.  I was almost tempted to put this at number one on my list. Amazing stuff.

Rating #2400.  Skyview is a freaking rock god!  Yellow color with some alcoholic swirling.  Aroma of buttery apples.  Sweet mercy, the taste... pure Granny Smith apples.  It manages to taste like apple pie, without being packed full of spices.  It is predominantly sweet, but just a bit of tartness.  Oh god is this amazing.
Sample @ Københavnskeøldage 2007. Wow! Full bodied - slightly sweet and lots of sour notes. Really complex and well balanced.

This ice cider pours a light orange gold color from a 375 ml bottle. No head. Aroma is apples with some blue cheese. Full bodied cider. Very fruity, mostly apple flavors, some green apples, some smoke and a touch of blue cheese. Very smooth tasting. The finish is fairly crisp and a touch tart. Kind of sweet and there is a very definite alcohol presence here. Very similar to the Frimas ice cider, I could drink either of them a lot. This one is a touch funkier and not as full I think. I would love to do a side by side with the Neige and Frimas. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is sweet with a touch of tart.

First off, let me state that this is the best liquid there is.  Ever.  This particular bottle said it was bottled in 2004, and the percentage is 10% ABV.  Color is a beautiful deep orange to coppery golden color.  Aroma is basically pure apple, with just the slightest hint of mulling spices.  Flavor is also incredibly apple, again with a hint of mulling spices.  It literally does taste exactly like non-alcoholic apple cider, or perhaps the condensed liquids of apple pie.  Mouthfeel is thick and syrupy, and perfectly still.  This is hands down the most delicious alcohol and/or liquid I have ever had.  Awesome.

Crystalline body, light golden in color with very fine bubbles evenly dispersed, triangular legs left behind. Looks still nonetheless. The color is gorgeous, so lively and bright. The aroma is medium intensity and nearly all apple. Somewhat tart and mildly sweet, the nose is grand and intense enough to mask the higher alcohol levels well. The nose is very fresh and superior in its cleanliness. The flavor is clean as well and much the same as the aroma. Moderately sweet, lightly sticky, mild acidity cutting through the sweetness. An addition of light spice marches forward in intensity with each sip. Alcohol is completely hidden in the taste. A light hint of white pepper ushers in a soft and elegant finish that has great length and is very crisp, extremely refreshing for something thats is the ultimate result of such condensing of fruit and sugars. The mouthfeel is as soft as snowflakes, lightly syrupy but not enough to be bothersome at all. Awesome cider.

375ml bottle from robinvboyer.  Aroma:  Intense apple aroma from the moment I popped the cork.  Green apples.  Equal parts sweet and tart.  Light spice and a subtle alcohol note.  Appearance:  Light golden in color and clear.  No carbonation.  Flavor:  Intense apple flavor.  Starts out fairly sweet with some dried apricot notes, but finishes with a nice tart bite.  Some light spice and a slight  touch of yeast.  Tart and dry finish with alot of apple flavor carrying over.  The flavor hangs with you a long time.  Excellent.  Palate:  Medium bodied.  No carbonation.  Pleasant alcohol burn in the back of mouth.  Overall:  I was expecting something similar to an Ice Wine with this.  It was much better than most of the Ice Wines Ive had the chance to try.  A perfect blend of sweet and tart.  It mentions foie gras on the label, and I couldnt agree more.  A perfect way to end a meal.

Bottle from beerbuzzmontreal, thanks a ton!!!  Aroma is of sweet apples and cinnamon--sugary and wonderful.  Gorgeous golden color.  Thick and full palate.  The taste is like baked apple pie--sweet, but also spicey.  Incredible stuff.

Here, let me ask you guys something. Do you ever have a sneaking, gnawing feeling that theres something in life youre supposed to find, finally? And that the time youre spending right now is somehow wasted if you dont feel its being spent in the service of getting you to that thing?

Well, thats exactly how I felt. At least until I tried the Neige Ice Cider.

Appearance: Pours a clear, still golden body.

Smell: A fruity, earthy aroma of a fine cheese course served alongside candied apples, honey, flowers, and vanilla beans.

Taste: Ultra-condensed, outstandly sweet apple juice, like the distilled spirit of Johnny Appleseed! Lush undertones of honey and vanilla. Hints of citrus and nutmeg. While there is a bit of tartness, it ultimately gives way to the liqueur-like sweetness. Yet it still manages to relatively finish both crisp and clean.

Mouthfeel: Medium-full body. Syrupy mouthfeel, though the alcohol helps to keep things moving along nicely. 

Drinkability: Finally, someone rightfully decided to give the noble apple the dessert wine treatment.
375ml bottle  Heavy aroma of Bleu Cheese, pecans.  flavor is sharp, acidic & sweet at the same time.  This is absolutely Superb!  Ah, salad with blue cheese buttermilk and pecans.
Pours a deep golden apple color with no head.  Aroma is lots apples, picking up a couple of different kinds.  Flavor is a hint of tart apples then finishes thick, sweet, and slight alcohol.
Sample at Mondiale 07.  The aroma and appearance is apple juice, but the taste is very good apple wine, with a sweet finish and a good drinkability.  Like an ice wine, good shared at a meal.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2007 wow.....amazing bright gold color. 
aroma is beautiful! sweet ripe apples, brown sugar, and a tinge of white wine. Mouthfeel is thick, and sweet, but not cloying. Flavour is again, beautiful ripe apples. The apples just burst in your mouth, and coat your palate. let it warm a bit, and the apples are even more intense, now i see why this is top 3 in thw world. Absolutely outstanding!

Bottle courtesy of ughsmash.  Pours apple yellow and still with a nice neck.  Smells of sweet apples, apple sauce and subtle sugary hints.  Tastes very tarte with an explosion of cider apple flavor.  Warming alcohol is noticable but not overwhelming.  As far as ciders go, this is way up there.  Mouthfeel is tarte and dry with some hints of dessert wine.  Finish is of dry apples with a peppery aftertaste.  Im definitely bringing a few bottles of this home with me when Im in Montreal this weekend.

Huge thanks to jayg for sharing this one with all of us at the Orlando gathering.

Pours a wonderful golden sunny body with no head. Aromas of apples, sweet fruits and some tartness. Flavors of apples and honey. Finishes with an amazing sweetness, coating the mouth and the back of the throat. My first ice cider, and I am afraid I was ruined myself on them by trying this one first. Amazing.

Courtesy jay to the motherfuckin g.  Pours a burnt orange color.  The aroma, although pleasant was slightly mild, with some sweet apples and other citrus fruits.  Really fresh smelling.  Big sweet granny smith apple flavors run rampid on my tastebuds upon the first sip.  Really smooth and oily, coating my palate like a blanket.  Just lovely.  Better than the first ice cider I tried, and I want to try more of them.

My second ice cider.  200 mL bottle from trade with beerbuzzmontreal.  Smooth, clean apple aroma with a hint of alcohol.  Thick pour, light straw color.  Extremely smooth taste, tart finish.  Neither the tartness nor the alcohol was overbearing, but the apple character was strong.  Elegant.  This easily eclipsed the previous ice cider Id had.  Thanks, Denis.

I am not often left at a loss, this is indeed one of those moments.  Aroma is fully on apples, but brings to mind some of Germanys finest Riseling Eiswines.  Some apple-pie spice flavors peek through.  Sweetness is balanced perfectly with the acidity.  AMAZING!!!!
Bottle. A golden cider with a small white head. The aroma is of apples, alcohol and spices. The taste is light acid and sweet sour apples, alcohol and spices. Medium to full body with a sweet finish.

Deep golden body; Huge incredibly concentrated nose, really like condensed cider, but then it has a strange touch of non perfumed lotion, and not fresh apples, not bad but strange; Deep medium complex body, super sweet, oily soft, sharp present sourness; The sourness evolves in a very long finish, still super sweet, with ripe apple aromas, perfumed, great.
Bottle at Københavnske Øldage 2007. Clear cobber - no head. Very smooth. High sweetness, concentrated apple juice, honey. A bit as powerfull as unfiltrated coldpressed applejuice. Very nice.

bottle (200ml, clear).  Via trade with mouton_noire.  Rating #2200.  "Récolte 2005."  Pours oily-looking clear refractive brass-gold, no head, no bubbles, but from what I know of ice wines, this is exactly as it should be.  The aroma is initially mild (needed to warm), eventually it opened to reveal a complex combination of sweet ripe apple, a little brown sugar, some bone-dry musty white wine and a hint of tartness.  Taste - just wow.  Who would ever drink ice wine again after this?  Smooth, silky, real-apple, sweet but not cloying, a hint of light spice hovering in the background, warming but muted alcohol, no aftertaste (other than apple), no burn - man thats a fine thing.  Silky, sticky body - neither thick nor watery, just perfect, really, not carbonated but thats not the point here, it just sits on the tongue and you mourn its passing and realize why its so expensive.  Stunning.

Bottle from puzzl. Pours clear, pale and still. The aroma is heavily floral, clover, apples and a honey like sweetness. The flavor is uber concentrated apple sweetness, honey, clover and just a touch of tartness on the finish. Full, sticky body is very dense and coating. Nice sipper. Its not the French style cider that I usually like, but this is really nice for what it is.

5/4/07.  Poured out of 200 mL bottle, obtained in a trade with Olivier_MTL on RateBeer 12/3/05.  2005 Vintage.  Lovely, luminescent, crystalline golden color, completely still (as expected) and with several silky viscous legs on the sides of the glass.  Aroma is of tart green apples, a little bit of a Jolly Rancher fakeness to it but mostly just bright, zippy crisp sour apple.  Theres also a touch of alcohol burn in the nose that either dissipates quickly through evaporation or fades into the apple tartness and tickles my nose into submission.  I really cant tell exactly, but I think theres a little of both going on.  The beautiful thing about this stuff is how well-integrated all of the flavors are, and at 12% ABV the alcohol is one of the primary among them.  The taste captures a lot of the same apple candy and fresh juice with some mead-like honey character, then a very soft touch of earthiness and apple skin down the finish.  Medium length on the finish with a slightly sticky, sappy residue left on the lips.  Slick medium body with a fuzzy burn down the throat and gentle warmth on the sides of the mouth.  It may be funny to say with such a sweetly fruity concoction, but if the finish were a bit drier, this stuff would be even more lovely.  A real treat for a grown-up juice lover looking for a new indulgence.

This cider was a nice surprise gift in by my Secret Santa...interestingly on my beer hiatus this got lost in the mix and I re-discovered it tonight. This pours an orangey slight yellow mix with a thin soapy head that is whisked quickly away. Aroma is apples, tartness, alcohol, grapey-goodnesses thereof, some hints of honey and mahogany. WOW, no wonder this runs so much a bottle...that was perhaps the smoothest 12% ABV I have EVER experienced. Tart and extremely crisp, flavors are long developing with a bittering dew drop ending. Thick and syrupy with just the slightest warming of alcohol, no carbonation necessary. Oh god this is nice. Apples suddenly dont suck anymore. Finish is extremely crisp, and chewy....mmmmmmmm. Bottle is dated 2002.

Tasting from bottle in Orlando, courtesy the ever so hospitable boboski. A cider? A style I sort of mock for being on these beer sites. However, giving Jason the benefit of doubt, I figured it would be a fine experience anyway. That was an underestimation, as this thing turned my eye open to the cider world moving forward. Complexity clearly wasnt there like a fantastic beer, but boy, this thing was ever so smooth and fine. A beautiful golden color, a very enticing candied-apple aroma with a flavor that just beautifully engaged nose and tongue. Im not sure how other ciders will stack up against this one, but Im gonna have to shoot for some stuff in between this and Woodchuck (haha), see how the other upper end products do (hopefully better than the mead world has been for me between Jadiwaga and Mead X). Wow, a cider! A big huge thanks to Jason again for sharing this one, a rarity, a very excellent product, and a mind altering experience.

375mL, no date.  Pours a crystal clear honey golden with a couple bubbles.  Nice legs.  Aroma of apples, brandy/alcohol, honey, and some vinousness.  Very sweet.  Flavor is terribly thick and sweet with some delicious tart apple qualities, a bit of brandy, and some spice I cant figure out.  Wow, from the aroma I wasnt expecting a ton, but the flavor is frickin amazing.  The alcohol is noticeable, but theres so much sweetness and tartness that it never burns or detracts, but complements.  Sweet finish.  Apples linger in the mouth for a looooong time.  Full syrupy body with no carbonation.  Would be an excellent digestif or with some good stinky strong cheese, as peter already suggested.  The best cider Ive ever had--totally awesome.  I purchased this @ Johns Grocery around 6mos. ago, and of course they sold out within a couple days.  I wish Id grabbed another one.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: bottle from JimMack at Dickinsonbeers 1/20/07.  clear glossy golden yellow color, honey and apple aroma, a little musty.  flavor is very sweet, apples , and a faint touch of calvados.  nice warming finish.  thanks, Jim!

Thanks to Summer Santa 06.  Waiting till we hit Texas winter (about 70F) before trying this.  One of the most enjoyable and intense apple experiences I have had.  I grew up around a cider mill, and this lovely beverage brought back many fond memories.  Quite sweet, it does well to pair very sharp cheeses.

KSBF 06.  Pours a thick syrupy clear gold with no carb.  Aroma is very powerful and hits you from a few feet away from the glass.  Sticky sweet, sugary, apples, apple juice, honey, flowery, and vinous.  Super sweet flavor and I remember making some wierd faces- this is the epitome of cloying- as it really makes your mouth pucker it is so damn sweet.  As long as it is sipped in small amounts it is enjoyable.  Very sweet apple juice/cider, sticky syrup, ripe green apple, and a wierd tartness that comes through in the end after all the syrupy sweetness.  This was a nice cider- perfect desert drink in moderation.

KSBF:06 Post Fest RB gathering:: Clear gold pour, still. Fresh,flowery apple nose, notes of cinnamon, fresh peeled apple skins. Body is light with a coating mouthfeel. Sweet apple flavors, light alcohol notes, citrus notes, lightly vinous with an OTOP sweetness and a little touch of tartness lying back there. Finish is sweet and fruity. Not what i was expecting but enjoyable none the less. Props to willblake! I think?
KSBF 2006 RB after party.  Pours a translucent golden with no head.  Aroma of apples, honey, white wine, fresh apple juice.  Flavor was very sweet, apple juice, sticky and sweet.

375mL bottle.  Medium golden-honey, slight orange tinge, crystal clear, headless.  Smells like fresh cider, apples, slight alcohol.  Huge, sweet mouthfeel, viscous with a slight tartness, incredible amounts of apples, well-hidden alcohol.  Long, honey-laden finish.  Awesome cider.

Pours a deep golden, looking almost syrupy, with little head or carbonation.  The aroma is intense!  It smells like fresh-cut granny smith apples, but theres so much more.  I cant identify all the components, but its heady!  The flavor is even more intense.  I made the mistake of taking a good-sized swallow, and it was way too much!  As suspected, its thick and syrupy, like an intense dessert wine, a little too syrupy for me.  The flavors are magical; Ive never tasted any cider that even came close.  The only problem is that even a 375ml bottle is way too much for me (in a way that a 750ml Speedway isnt).

In a flute. I just cant get enough of this wonder. It is a clear pale golden colour with a wonderfull aroma. At first, it is like being in front of fresh apples that are being crushed, then, there is spices, cinnamon, vanilla, honey and flowers. It smells like a hot and fresh apple  pie. The taste is just as rich, magnificient apples, cinnamon, honey, flowers, vanilla with a full body, almost syrupy. The alcool is well hidden. I just dont know how Frimas could be better then this one.  The only problem is the price, otherwise, I would  have it every day of the week and twice ond week-ends.

Bottle thanks a million to Richlikebeer for sharing this with us. Rating #1000. Crystal clear golden color with obviously no head. Incredible apple aroma with notes of honey and caramel. Beautiful flavor of sweet apples, with the apple skins giving off a bit of their tannins, brightening the flavor even more. Some honey and a bit of cinnamon round out the flavor. This cider is so freaking smooth, and the alcohol is so well hidden. Thanks Rich, for my favorite beverage of the RBSG 06 and for giving me a memorable 1000th rating!

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2011 Bottle... This cider rocks!... Clear, very pale cider. The aroma is of fresh apples, brown sugar and sugar cookie. Apple pie flavor (crust and all) with vanilla and a discreet tanginess. A touch of alcohol. Full-bodied and oily. Sweet, tangy, drying finish. A big thanks goes out to my cuz, Jerry, for bringing this back from his hiking/backpacking excursion across Canada, ending in Banff.

2003 Vintage, 50 mL bottle from SAQ. Rated July 2006. Crisp golden yellow body coats the sides of the glass a bit. Sweet alcoholic apple aroma. More tart acidity and less syrupy sweetness than some other ciders. Flavour really "pops" with a refreshing acidity. Medium palate suits it well. Very nice cider.
Bu sur place. Belle couleur jaune. arome très plaisant de pomme sucré. Le goùt est comme croqué dans une pomme, mmmm!
Golden apple juice looking. Oily and sticky with no head. Earthy aroma with tones of bark and sweet apples. Tart and sweet flavors. Odd. Notes of alcohol. Thick with a hot finish.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2006 A truly generous trade from Boutip!  Thanks!  Jen wanted something sweet last night so this is what she got.  Pours golden and clear with orange hints.  Very much like a brandy in appearance.  Sweet ice wine aroma.  Crisp fruit (melon, and Riesling grape), syrup, and light metallic hints.  The flavor is WOW!  Sweet and slightly tart.  A real explosion of apple and honey mixed with hints of other fruit (passion fruit?).  Lightly warm alcohol (hardly noticeable).  Crisp all around which is amazing considering the leanings towards a heavy mouth feelmust be the alcohol holing it up.  Wonderful stuff!  Would have this on any sunny afternoon, or for dessert.  The price is prohibitive and my sample was only 1.5  2 oz.  Still, it is a must try!

Neige 2004. Golden yellow cider. Light apple sauce aroma. Sweet apples in mouth, syrupy, with smooth alcohol notes, delicious and pleasing. Medium to rich vbodies, with viscous qualities. At Salon des Vins et Spiritueux de Montréal, March 25 2006.

375 ml bottle thanks to Sasquach 911.  Amber gold with no head and no bubbles.  Thats ok, its not beer anyway.  Aromas were very fruity.  Apple, Pear, sugar, alcohol.  Even a bit of tarness is detected on the nose.   Wow, those flavors are stong.  Very very sweet with face slamming apple and alochol.  Apple pie finish.  Mouth feel is very big.  Thick and syrupy.  A bit distracting actually.  No carbonation really.  Stuff just kinda slides down.  Good... I liked it as you can see from the aroma and flavor points, but a little too thick for me.

Je ne suis pas un grand connaisseur de cidre de glace, mais cette "Neige" est fabriqué à partir de pommes MacIntosh, mes pommes préférées. Agréable mélange entre le sucré et lacide. Très doux au palet, un peu huileux.--I am not a ice cider connaisseur but this "Neige" is made of MacIntosh apples, my favorite ones. Good mix of sweetness and acid. Very sweet in mouth, almost oily.

Thanks to CaptainCougar for this cider.  50 mL bottle.  Pours a still pale gold.  Smells of green apples, pears, a bit of alcohol.  Taste is both very sweet and very tart, with strong notes of green apples and pears, with sticky syrupy body.  The sweetness hits you first followed closely by a sourness that puckers in the back of your throat.  Cinnamon notes arise in the finish.  Tastes very fresh, very reminiscent of fresh picked fruit.  I could have used a much larger bottle of this, but Ill savor the little that I have.

2002 vintage 50 ml bottle from my 2005 winter secret santa.  The bottle is SO tiny it amuses me.  Its hard to believe what the price of this stuff is.  Anyway, I poured it into my glass.  The cider pours to an elegant bright golden body.  Very clean looking.  Looks filtered, but I dont know if it is.  The aroma is very appley.  Nice candied apples.  The flavor is very delicate and wonderful.  I havent had a lot of ciders, but this one tastes like very fresh apples.  Very concentrated refined apple sugars.  Very hard to describe.  More like a quality apple brandy or cognac than "cider".  Ever have a baked cinnamon apple?  This is sorta like that, sorta like a homemade apple pie.  All I can say is mmmm, I cant wait to try the Frimas!  The palate is quite dry yet sweet.  Kinda like a Riesling wine?  It leaves a heavy sugary and appley palate but isnt offensive.  Its almost creamy and is coating.  More like I was just eating apples... I dont know how to rate ciders, but this is really good stuff.  Not cloying in the slightest.  im very impressed!  Now, I can save the 375 I bought for a tasting or for XMas dinner. :)

Bouteille claire de 375 ml achetée directement chez le producteur. Récolte 2003. Arôme: Odeur de pommes acidulées, de foin et de terre. Apparence: Couleur dorée. Saveur: Goût de pomme légèrement sûrettes et une pointe dalcool. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est plein avec une texture sirupeuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût de pommes. (Rating #353)

A dark orange cider with no head. The aroma contains lots of apples, but also a slight hint of alcohol. The flavor is wonderful, sugar sweet with strong notes of apples, and a rather dry end. The sourness from the apples bites the tongue slightly.

50cc bottle provided by SpringsLicker.  Pours  a still, clear golden color.  Sweet and acidic apple aroma nearly fills the room.  When the nose gets close there is the thought of apple core left to warm.  Medium to full bodied.  Nearly syrupy.  Coating and pleasant mouthfeel.  Tart and lightly acidic, not to the point of overkill.  Moderately boozy.  Full apple flavors, lightest amount of must.  Damn pleasant experience!

Dark Yellow/gold. Pronounced aroma of honey and maple, plus, of course, a persistant note of apples. Oh, and a touch of hard candy. Great syrupy thick palate. Flavor is kind of candied apple and a succulent, sweet finish. Just a hint of basement mustyness, as well. Big thanks to Springslicker for sharing!

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2008 This was one of the great suprises on our trip to Montreal. My wife and I were out for diner at a nice seafood place Maestro SVP and they had a cider on special. I asked if they had iced cider and they did, it was C$8.50 a glass. Pretty much around the same price as their inexpensive wines. My wife and I both loved it, such a treat. I brought home a big, 500ml bottle for us, and I brought back a couple 50ml bottles for raters, me included. I served the cider at 35°/2°C in a flute glass. The cider is gold, looks like most white wines. When swirled, the cider coats the glass. The aroma is tart, steely apples with some            baked apple flavor far in the background. The cider is very sweet initially, but that is quickly replaced by citrus, lemon,  tart apples and a touch of cleansing alcohol. The finish is mildly tart, maybe a touch sweet and a lingering sour apple flavor. It is over way too soon. The great thing is, the frimas is even better!

Nice choice for rating number 1800. A great sipping still cider. The bottle is a joy to observe with the dark gold liquid in side. This poured a beautiful dark yellow body. This is obviously a large cider as it sticks to the glass with swirling. The aroma had light vanilla and honey with flowers and fresh apples.The taste is initially tart with and intense floral and honey character. Macintosh apples and some Grany Smith. Obviously, this one is meant for sipping. The finish is rich and coppery with a little herbal character. The mouthfeel is thick and sticky. A very impressive cider, but it is almost like a quality mead, in that, you only want to enjoy a little bit, not drink for a session.

Thanks to egajdzis for this one...
I believe this is my first "ice cider".
Appears the color of apple juice with no head and no lacing. Carbonation seems mild too.
Smell is of MacIntosh apples and some slightly tart Granny Smiths thrown in at some point.
Tast is slightly grainy and malty with a tart apple taste.
Mouthfeel...slightly grainy and sweet with tart notes.
Drinkability is ok. Seems proper with the Autumnal season to drink this.

Bottle shared courtesy of egajdzis (thanks!). 03 vintage. Poured a light and see through golden color with a very small sized head. Looks just like apple juice. Aromas and tastes of fresh squeezed apples with some spices in there. Alcohol content very well hidden (I could drink this with my morning cereal!). I have a hard time rating ciders - this one was very good.

2003... Poured a golden color with a small, off white head that left nice legs on the glass.  Aroma of sweet, crispy, green apples, spices, and a light sweetness as well.  Taste of more spices, including cinnamon, lots of apple (both sweet red, and tart green) and finishing very dry, no alcohol noticed in the taste.

Poured a clear golden yellow with some legs.  Sweet aorma of crisp fresh apples and notes of honey.  Flavor starts off sweet but never becomes too much.  Nice crisp apple turns to a fresh apple cider like I used to get from the farm stands.  Warming form alcohol that never dominates and senses.  At 12% this could have been  dangerous if my bottle wasnt the size served on an airplane or my wife didnt finish it while my head was turned.  Damn her.

Bottle at the tasting roomYellow green, darker than degel. The nose is sweet, bright, earthy, some mushroom, the flavor is sweet, not overly so. Crisp tartness, delicious. Light alcohol taste but the feeling is intense, a bit much, over the top but tasty.

Pour is nice high yellow...smell is apple, alcohol, seems very dry and hints of oak...leaves nice legs inside the glass...syrupy sweet with alcohol toward the back...finish is a little tart apple...nice...

(2002 vintage; many thanks Denis and Hughes!!!):
A deep golden gown houses delicate honeyed apples and peaches in an almost lactic aroma...An unctuous mouthfeel seduces instantly and coats the tongue with noble and rich apple sweetness...Classy, without exaggeration, it finishes smoothly with a lightly tart apple peel tang which eases the next sip...Big, flavorful, and chic...

Big props to Oakes for bringing this gem back.  Still golden appearance.  Big thick legs coat the glass.  Aroma is amazing, sweet baked apples coated with caramel sauce, cinnamon, nutmeg and toffee.  There are also notes of almonds and honey.  The flavour is even more amazing, sweet baked apple, toffee, and spice coat the mouth in a velvety layer of pure appley goodness.  After the swallow, you get hit with woody vanilla, some pepper before a gorgeous malic acid tartness cuts through all of that sweetness and makes your mouth water for minutes.  Finish lasts and lasts.  Simply awesome!

07.10.05  v2003 bottle, RBSG tour.  Still, ice cider.  Golden green color like a thinly veiled caramel apple.  Earthy aromas, mushroom, soft honey, butterscotch, toffee.  Ripe and tannic up front.  Long on the palate.  Streaking legs on the (beautiful) glass.  Retronasal is apple pie with vanilla ice cream.  Beautiful stuff, a miracle.

Bright light golden colour, with legs.  Sweet aroma with bright fruits, pie crust and sugar.  Rich, brown sugar palate with lots of fruit.  Warmth comes in late but well-balanced by all the sugars.  Light spice in the finish.  A liquified apple crumble.

RBSG bottle
Clear gold color. Beautiful legs. 
Fresh apple aroma, earth and spice. Complex. Light syrup on the tongue. Again nice amount of sweetness but very little acidity. Very tasty!

(2003 Vintage, RBSG05) Crystal clear apple juice body (richer color than the degel), beautiful long legs.  Aroma is medium sweet, apple, tart, exceptionally clean, fresh.  Faint alcohol detected but no syrup.  Taste is sweet, apple, tart, light liqueur.  Finish is fantastically fresh apple.  Medium body, clean, alcohol very well hidden.  Maybe my ignorance of ciders is revealed here, causing me to inflate my score.  Regardless, I was blown away by this one.  I did buy some more, so I will see if I in fact like it as much as I think I do.

Bottle.  Clear dark yellow in colour, no head.  The aroma was of glazed apple pies sprinkled with cinnamon.  The flavour was of red apples, cinnamon, vinilla, peaches, cloves, quite floral and sweet all at the same time.  Large warming body, syrupy mouthfeel.  Finishes with a lingering candy apple sweetness.  Very good stuff and pretty easy to drink.

2003 Vintage: Deep, pale golden, still pour.  Sweet, rich aroma has a touch of light cinnamon and tartness.  Very sweet, candy-like, yet incredibly balanced, tart and full mouthfeel hides the alcohol very well.  Dangerous drinkability, considering the amount of alcohol and the price, but God, this stuff is good!

2004 bottle, sampled at Mondial, 6/4/05.  Very light pinot-grigio-like color, with just a touch of light tangerine juice color, adding a bit more depth.  Little to no legs on the glass.  Aroma is flowery, peachy and very simple.  Sweet apple juice, bits of funky mushed apples, golden delicious apple-skins and vanilla.  Flavor has plenty of apple-juice notes, clear, crisp and clean, with yellow apples, apple sauce and light dry yeast notes.  A touch of more concentrated honeyish sugar and alcohol on the finish, light vanilla, cloves/nutmeg and a warming sensation are felt.  Light textured and very belying the 12 abv, not syrupy nor cloying.  Easy drinking ice-cider.

Aroma:strong apple...
Appearance:Yellow dark.....
Flavor:Sugar,apple,light alcohol sensation......

Bottle: Poured a dark yellow still cider. Aroma of sweet concentrated apple juice with a liquorish feel to it. Taste is sweet though not overly sweet with a discreet warming feeling from the alcohol. I have no problem of believing that 3kg of apple are include in this bottle. Very good stuff overall.

Perfect golden color, clear, calm in the glass, majestuous when shaken, displaying small legs. Aroma feels like pure apple flesh, sweet and in control, liqurous, but just enough. Nevertheless, it doesnt strike me down in awe. The flavor comes closer. Condensed apples glory. Classy alcohol feel over rhubarb, pie crust, cloves, pear skin notes, The texture is very oily and thus reminds a bit of nuts. Gentle tart aspect, though nowhere near refreshing. Intense mouth presence, limiting its syrupy sweetness on the verge of "non-cloyingness".  JW Lees of ciders mouthfeel wise. Splendid ice cider, glorious apple showdown! I wish I could find 45$ in the street to rush and buy their Frimas.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2007 Pours a clear golden color. Aroma of baked apples. Excellent sweet and acind flavor of baked apples with a bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2005 50 ml sample bottle.  Oily clear light gold, legs of icicle last and last....the nose uncovers deep wafts of baked apple, alcohol and a touch of cinnamon...the tongue responds with thick juiciness and surprisingly little alcohol flavor for 12%, a wonderful sweet/sour balance of apples, no metallic twinges as I often find in strong ciders and meads, and interesting hints of sourdough and pepper near the finish in a slightly oily, thick body.  Delightful.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2005 Looks like translucent liquid gold.  Older vintages tend to darken a bit.  A big splash of apple in the nose, with other sweet hints hidden here and there, vanilla and oak notes as well.  The first sip is like a million apples got concentrated into a single drop that explodes the instant it hits your tongue.  Im not a big apple juice drinker, but the balance of tart and sweet makes this ice cider totally worth it.  To feel it ice cold in your mouth and come down warm and soothing down your throat is a totally unique experience.
Mild, sweet strong apples in the nose. Clear, deep golden. Still and viscous. Sweet apples - liqueur-like flavour. Full-bodied. Gentle alcohol warming. Bottle (sampled at Mondial 2004).

(200ml bottle) Pours an oily textured, amber body. Slight sedimentation. Nose of sweet macintosh apples and wood. Sweet flavour is nicely balanced by a tart undertone. So easy to drink that I may finish the bottle tonight. Delicious!
